Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z1 (C6902) Unlocked GSM Quad-Core Water Resistant/Dust Proof Smartphone w/ 20MP Camera- Purple
Reviews: An excellent small form factor Android device. This devices size brings back a day where all cell phones were similar in size and it wasn't about screen size (back then) it was about what was inside.This device is packed w/ todays mid to high end specs, that said, the screen resolution is not quite on par with today's specs.This is a rare device/company that brings Android 4.4.4 quickly to their devices. Within the first week of ownership, the device morphed from Android 4.4.2 to 4.4.4. We own several "high end" Android devices (HTC M8, LG G3 etc) and not one has 4.4.4 yet.Overall, this device is compact durable and comfortable to hold. It does however need some kind of re-work on all the "doors" which acess things such as the usb port. This is defiantly something I can see breaking, rather easily.This is well made, I would recommend this to any user looking for a change back to a decent sized device.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z1 (C6902) Unlocked GSM Quad-Core Water Resistant/Dust Proof Smartphone w/ 20MP Camera- Purple
Reviews: Going from a Nexus 4 (and another xperia before that). This phone is just pure bliss. It's blazing fast, it's got features that are unique, and the camera is top notch.Pros:1. Great Camera - Sometimes I feel like I'm using a DSLR (especially using addon apps). The nighttime photos are even great. And more recently, if you unlock you can get 4k video + 120 FPS - crazy slow mo.2. Great Apps - most apps can be disabled that you don't like, but this is only of the only phones I have kept more than half of the "bloat" ware. Unlike Samsung, Sony decided to make some useful apps.3. Updates/Upgrades - This phone is expected to upgrade to the latest "L" android so you have nothing to worry about.4. Sleek look - If you look at this phone without a case, I would say its one of the best looking phones out there. It just looks and feels "premium".5. Waterproof/Dustproof - I don't worry about sweating my phone to death now, so i've got that going...which is nice.Cons:1. Whats New App - seriously the dumbest app known to man. And they placed it near google now to I guess compete with it. You can disable it without root, but you need to do it with your computer and adb drivers (pretty easy once you read up on it).2. Slippery - this phone feels like it's made of a slightly melted butter stick - get a rubberized case as soon as possible or you will drop it. I wish Sony would send me the lube they are using to make this glass... for science.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z1 (C6902) Unlocked GSM Quad-Core Water Resistant/Dust Proof Smartphone w/ 20MP Camera- Purple

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z1 Compact D5503 Android Smartphone (Lime) International Version No Warranty
Reviews: I loved the phone when I first got it, amazing camera, great battery life, speed, waterproof, small etc... but....it has been a year and a half and the battery is completely shot. A high-end expensive phone should not have the battery crap out so quick. So you know..initially it held a charge for 2-3 days w/moderate usage, now I'm lucky if I get a few hours and then it turns off without warning. The charge indicator will say 50% next thing I know it turns off. Very disappointed since I spent over 450 for this phone. Now I'm looking into having the battery replaced however it will no longer be waterproof.

Reviews: KATHLEEN RICHARDS

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z1 Compact D5503 Android Smartphone (Lime) International Version No Warranty
Reviews: Hey you on the verge of buying this amazing cell phone!Like you, I researched this device for a long time and read all the reviews, good and bad. I liked the way it looks so much that in spite of the mixed reviews about it, I decided to take a leap of faith and buy it. As of right now, after heavy using it for 6 days, I'm loving everything about it. All the specs are true! this is a fantastic device, that looks, feels, and performs great. Use it the way it is supposed to be used, don't abuse it. Get familiar with the capabilities and limitations. I bought the front and back protective shields, a clear rubber case, and a magnetic charging port. Before starting to use it, I updated it to the latest operational system available, and finally activated it with my current carrier, which is Metro pcs!If something happens, I will update this review!

Reviews: My previous phone, Nokia N8 was the best on its time... I wanted to stay with Nokia, but their failure to put a microSD slot on their best camera phone, Lumia 1020, made me look around..So, I went with Sony Xperia Z1, for the specs, and Compact because I want a great phone that doesn't look like I am holding a tablet against my face when I am talking on it.Great specs, with this phone I haven't experienced any lag with game or any app...Great camera, one of the best out there.Cons, Screen seems a lil dark, even by increasing the brightness and speaker not the best...Still 5/5, the best you can get right now.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z1 Compact D5503 Android Smartphone (Lime) International Version No Warranty
Reviews: I have a Nexus 5 and I really love it, but I have been looking for a change. I hate this trend of making high end smart phones giants. Ill admit that the 5in screen size makes reading small text in games and dealing with emails easier, but it is not an ideal size for holding. The small size is wonderful to hold and the phone feels great in hand not HTC One great, With clean lines surrounding the two beautiful slabs of glass. I wish they would have pushed the screen size up a bit the borders are kinda large, its just a waste of space, when other phones on the market are smaller with similar specs. The color was my only concern when buying this device. Its stated as Lime but in all photos I have viewed its just yellow. I think Sony is confused on what color lime is, when held in certain indirect light you can see the green in the paint. If you do not want a yellow phone get the white model. I enjoy the color more than i thought that I would, its great to look at and i find myself placing the phone on its screen more than i would with any thing i own, just to see the back.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: The Xperia Z3 Compact is a flagship level Android smartphone. Build materials are top-notch, and the device is visually elegant. Applications operate with virtually no lag. The camera performs well, although I would have preferred optical image stabilization over digital image stabilization. The battery lasts for about 2 days with WiFi and Bluetooth turned on, and I have managed to go 3 days without charging on some occasions. I use the Sony magnetic charging dock to avoid having to open the micro-usb port cover every time I charge the phone.The first Z3C that I received was a Central American model which unfortunately was defective since the nano-sim slot cover would not stay closed. The second Z3C that I received was a European model. It has been functioning well for 2 months now.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: I read so many good things about this phone. Battery life is great but most everything else sucked. Camera was terrible especially the front one which took horribly grainy photos even in non low light situations. It couldn't take photos underwater because the touch screen wouldn't respond when it was under water. The first one I ordered had been opened and came with a different plug and want the standard American plug or adapter. The next one I got hadn't been opened but also didn't come with an American plug although it had an I'll fitting adapter.The biggest kicker was that i couldn't send or receive MMS messages with this phone on T-Mobile. They sent the issue to their engineering department, we went over the APN settings time and again and they finally figured out it was that this phone couldn't send them for some reason. Couldn't send snapchat photos at first either although that resolved after some updates and restarts to the phone.Thank you to Amazon for having a great return policy because this phone was nothing like the reviews

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: I deeply regret to buy SONY XPERIA Z3. The seller sent me the product in the expected conditions, the problem is the product. The second time that I used the WATER PROOF cellphone, less than 10 min and no more than 1.5 m (respecting the specifications) WATER GOT INSIDE AND OF COURSE, CELLPHONE WAS DAMAGED. I sent to Sony, they did the tests and said it was my fault! LESS THAN 3 MONTHS and I just threw my money away. I had only 3 phones in my life ( 7 years since I got the the first) I just bought new ones because they did not attend my demand, but they were working. So, who has the fault? Listen to me, DO NOT BUY SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT, because if something happens, you will lose your money, It is not worth taking the risk,

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: I'm about as happy with this as I could ever be with a smart phone. I still miss my old flip phone with mechanical keys and the old T9 word no-eyes-needed texting, but alas smartphones do have many conveniences such as GPS and music playing.BATTERY LIFE: Fantastic, I get ~3 days from normal usage. THREE DAYS!SIZE: Slightly bigger than an iPhone 4s. Acceptable. I don't want an HDTV in my pocket.CALLS: No complaints, I use T-Mobile and get pretty good coverage and data rates in New Jersey.ANDROID: Upgraded to Lollipop, works fairly well, had some issues with getting some apps to use my microSD card correctly, was frustrating, but in the end got them to work. Google Maps etc. all work great. Slightly paranoid about Google in a 1984 kind of way. Annoys me to no end that the Amazon Prime app requires every permission from the operating system, including the ability to delete your account (yes, that's correct). I have not and don't plan to install the app until they release a Google Play friendly version. In general, Android is still less of a smooth experience (particularly when it comes to the touch interface) than Apple. Not taking away stars for these issues because they're not the fault of the phone manufacturer.MISC: Love that I can use a 128GB microSD card with this phone. I heard that screen cracks are common with this phone, so I got a case (Ringke Fusion) and I'm careful with it and so far so good in 3 months. No screen protector. Looks pretty. Nobody knows what phone this is, and that secretly makes me very happy inside. I can play music to my car via Bluetooth fairly easily. My car has steering wheel music controls which used to control my iPhone, I miss that, but I knew I was losing that when switching to Android. This phone also has an average EMF output which maybe will slightly reduce my risk of cancer. Who knows.SPEAKERS: Tinny and kind of crappy. Oh well.CAMERA: Pretty decent, not great in low light conditions, personally I don't take a lot of pictures with my phone so I don't really care much.

It just cracked as I was using it. One clean crack across the entire face, rendering it useless because the screen stopped working. If you google it, you'll see this is a common problem. I called Sony and they weren't much help. I couldn't find a phone repair shop in the U.S. that works on Sony phones. I tried to do it myself but kept running into more problems. Bottom line: it's a paper weight. Sony made a crappy product and then wouldn't help to fix it. Don't buy one.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: After 4 days, very happy with this phone. Takes great pictures and video. With the "Stamina" battery saving mode on, I can go 2-3 days between charging. And the phone is super fast with Quad Core processor (Item description is wrong, this phone has 2.5GHz Quad Core Snapdragon 801 processor).Only had very minor issues so far getting the to work in english and with AT&T. I bought it used from Amazon Warehouse Deals and when I received it, the menus were not in English (was either German or Dutch). Luckily, I was able to use Google Goggles on my android tablet to figure out which menu would reset the phone. When the phone resets, the first thing it asks is is what language, so after that it worked out fine. BTW, the phone is unlocked, but the original carrier was Vodafone in Europe. The phone works fine for me on AT&T. There are a couple of Vodafone apps that I was not able to remove, but they don't really effect my phone usage (so far). Once I got my AT&T SIM card in the phone I could call and send text messages right away, but I did have to download the proper internet settings to get on the internet. To find this menu option, goto:Settings>Wireless&Networks>More...>Internet Settingsand then check the box for your carrier. Then you should be on the internet.This is my first Android phone. I've really enjoyed my last 2 phones which were Windows Phones, but I wanted a better camera and I wasn't really satisfied with the current generation of Windows Phones. After being on the lookout for the past 3-4 months, this is the ONLY phone that really suits my needs. I wanted a phone that was about the same size as the iPhone 5 and my two things that I absolutely must have are a good camera with dedicated shutter button and long battery life (large battery or battery saving mode/feature. My ideal price range was under $400 but really if I found a phone with the right features, I would probably pay more. (I paid $415 used price). This phone is awesome because even though it is smaller than the regular Xperia z3, it is every bit as fast and nearly identical in specs to the bigger flagship model. The only difference in specs is screen resolution (720p), battery size (2600mAH vs 3100mAH) and RAM (2Gb vs 3 GB). Samsung and HTC make "mini" versions of their flagship phones, but the "mini" version is hobbled by poorer quality or less features. Those other "mini" flagship phones always have a slower processor, lower quality camera and other missing features compared to the flagship.One of my favorite features is the "Stamina" mode which extends battery life. I went all day yesterday and still had 89% battery left this morning (24 hours since charging). I do not like my phone beeping at me all day, so I don't have email, facebook or instagram pushing anything to my phone. I might spend 20-30 minutes during my lunch break checking in on my phone and then maybe 30-60 minutes in the evening after work. In Stamina mode, my phone does not go onto the internet unless the phone is open and unlocked. If the phone is in my pocket, it is off wifi. It also has a nifty location aware feature where it only turns on wifi based on location if it knows I am near WIFI networks that I have previously signed into. Otherwise WIFI is off. I only use the WIFI at work (no cell reception) and do not use it at home (AT&T LTE is faster on my phone than the Time Warner Digital Cable Roadrunner connection at home). With my 30-90 minutes of web browsing during the day, 2-3 instagram postings and 10-20 text messages a day, I only used 10% battery in 24 hours with the Stamina mode on. AMAZING!Bonus feature? It says it is water resistant. I haven't found out yet if that is true. I wouldn't drop it in water on purpose -doesn't seem like it is waterproof, but splashproof maybe. I will update if I find out one way or the other.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: Oh my God! I love this phone 📱 so much! Everything is so Cool 😎! I'm very happy!

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: No cyanogenmod available for it yet so the Sony-branded vibe instead of vanilla Android bothers me somewhat, but it's a fantastic upgrade from my Galaxy Nexus and a real pleasure to have flagship-level power in a compact phone. It's fast, smooth, and everything that you would expect in a new phone performance-wise.Very exciting that there is a camera button instead of having to tap the screen to take pictures (which often results in blurrier photos). I didn't test the camera in low-light conditions before unlocking the bootloader, so I can't comment on how much functionality/quality was lost there. The low-light photos I shoot now are neither impressively good or bad, just slightly grainy and slow like you would probably expect from a reasonable quality phone camera.Battery is awesome. I've been interacting with this a lot more than my old phone because it's new, and even with my constant fussing around all day, I'm only charging it once every two nights. I'm not watching movies all day or anything, but am actively customizing, installing, texting, trying out new apps, etc.The back is extremely slippery, like it was designed to be a high-performance air hockey puck. If it sits on anything with a slight incline, it starts gliding away by itself -- this includes rubberized surfaces. This is the first phone I've put a case on in the last 5 years, but this phone is small enough that I don't feel put off by a little extra bulk. That case is mostly to keep the phone from floating away on its slippery back.The notification light is in the corner and much more subtle than other phones that I have had, which could be a good or bad thing depending on your preference. I rely pretty heavily on Lightflow color notifications to silently let me know what is going on from across a room or table, so this may take some getting used to.It's kind of annoying to have to either use the wireless charging (which reviews from around the web have referenced can tear the plate out of the phone), or to have to remove the waterproof cover flap every time I need to plug in the USB cable. The flap is held on by a small piece of plastic so that it hangs off the phone during charging. I like to keep phones around for 2 years or so before upgrading, and wouldn't be too surprised if this broke during the usual life of my phones.Overall, a solid purchase that I am quite in love with, and cannot wait for stable alternative ROMs to appear!

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: Replaced my htc one with this phone. I never considered a Sony before, but an extremely pleased with this. Android skin is well done and not invasive. Feels solid, and it's extremely fast.And the battery life!! I've had two particular days when I tested it to the extreme. One had a 6 hour car ride, with Google Maps navigation running, as well as paying music through bluetooth. Battery used was only 30 for that entire time!The second was a day I forgot to plug in overnight. Woke up at 4am for a trip with under 10%. Put it on extreme pretty save mode, and by 6pm, still had 6% remaining. I've never had a smart phone that could last anywhere near that.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: All phones make tradeoffs, but this Sony provides some great improvements over the competition and is top-notch in every other aspect.The characteristic they have improved is battery life. About time! This phone lasts two days easily. My wife is a light user and she keeps it going for four days. During active use with LTE it will last more than five hours. Always without using the power saving modes.The other great quality is the small size. That is up to taste, but large phones are not for everybody.Other design choices I don't agree with. The glass back looks very neat but it is more slippery than you can imagine -it slides down ANY slightly inclined surface. With a transparent silicone case the orange phone still looks very stylish. The finish of the phone is flawless.Waterproofing I think is a gimmick. It will save your skin if the phone takes the occasional dunk, but the plastic covers don't feel robust -only friction keeps them in place. And the covers are very inconvenient to open for charging, so you are forced to buy the magnetic charger -there are good cheap adapters though.The screen is fine -all high end phones have gorgeous screens. The software is not too bloated -not having ATT junk makes a big difference. The phone is very responsive -all modern phones are.

Reviews: This phone has amazing battery life!!!! 2 days with life to spare with moderate use; blue tooth on, google now launcher in always listening mode, screen at 50% brightness (I get 4-5hrs screen on time). I updated to lollipop right away and tried to googlize my phone as much as possible and they experience is so similar to my old nexus 4. I may not get updates as fast as I use to but I have to say sony has done a better job with the lollipop update on this phone than the did with the nexus 4 or 5, especially the 5 because it has terrible memory leaks, connectivity issues, and random restarts after lollipop. I also love the small size of this phone!Things I don't like. Terrible camera app, and super auto settings. The camera can take nice photos, but it take effort, and I'm still not sure if they're as good as a nexus 5. I think sony put too much effort into cramming pixels onto a small sensor and the end results isn't very good. I also don't like the dialer/contact app sony uses. Its not as pretty or nearly as organized as the dialer on vanilla android. Sony's dialer doesn't have the search feature that as you typed numbers, business names/contacts would show up. I don't understand why sony used their own implementation when its missing features, is ugly, and does nothing unique. This is one app I can't googlize with a visit to the play store.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: Overall, this is the best phone I have ever used. Sony gets it and nailed all of the fundamentals. The waterproof camera and PS4 integration are icing on the cake. Note: Sony's bundled software should be removed immediately by installing the Google Now launcher and then disabling all of the bundled widgets and apps you don't want to use - it takes about 5 minutes to fix so this in no way affects my perspective here.AestheticsSony includes a beautiful, beautiful, beautiful live wallpaper that does not draw very much power. The device is completely unassuming so you don't need to worry if traveling with it and it being a giant golden shiny object.CameraI owned an iPhone 6+ before this, camera is as-good or better in favorable lighting situations and nearly as good in the dark. I swam in the ocean with this phone and took videos of Stingrays. The video came out surprisingly decent and the phone didn't break, so there's that.BatteryBest battery in any smart phone I have used in recent years and the best battery I have ever had in a touch-only / full screen phone. The LG Quantum, Blackberry, and AudioVox SMT5600 are comparable but these have tiny screens. For me, typical usage gets me 3-4 days. 3-4 days! Three to four days! On a powerful smart phone (more on that later). Even with the heaviest of heavy usage (surfing the web, playing games, etc) I have zero worries about running out of power.SizePhone feels perfect to me. I was a true believer in the "phablet" device category until I owned the 6+ and saw that the button and area above the speaker added giant vertical bezels. The Note II was bearable in the pocket but still could be frustrating to take out of the pocket - this phone sold me though, it's nice to have a big screen. Screen-wise though, this device has a great sized screen for its size. It has a larger screen than an iPhone 5 while remaining smaller and has a screen just .1" short of the iPhone 6 screen while remaining almost half an inch smaller vertically and a 1/10 an inch smaller in width. The thickness doesn't matter to me, anything thinner than this device becomes difficult for me to hold and I will take the extra 3 days of battery life any day. In short, you don't need a big phone to have a good sized screen.PerformanceMost devices like this (smart phones that are "smaller") have performance that is awful, remedial, puny, diminutive. In synthetic benchmarks, this phone can outperform a Samsung Galaxy S5. Boom.UpdatesSony has committed to updating the software at least to Android Lollypop ... but I would expect support to continue into the foreseeable future as Sony seems to be updating their entire line (e.g. Xperia Z1 from 18 months ago) to the latest Android versions. Sony is super developer friendly, offering AOSP builds for their entire line from http://developer.sonymobile.com/knowledge-base/open-source/open-devices. The current developer builds are Lollypop.GamingWorks with a PS4 controller giving you a better controller experience than ANY bluetooth controller on the market. Remote play on PS4 is awesome and looks and sounds as good as you would expect - playable just don't expect to be doing any competitive gaming over it.PriceI paid $500 for my phone, which is about $150-$350 less than a premium smart phone with similar features will cost you.I really hope that more manufacturers start making more phones like this, the balance of performance, camera, size, and battery are perfect.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: The GPS has never worked on this phone and I have only had it for about 4-weeks with no drops, I have babied this phone, and I even have a protective rubber sleeve around it. My first thought was that something in the settings was off, but after running PC Connect to update the software (replace factory defaults with all updates and fixes) it still did not work. I then installed GPS Status app and purged the assistance data as recommended by Sony: open the dialer and dial *#*#7378423#*#*, select Service tests -> GPS -> Purge assistance data and then restart the phone. This did not work either. Last attempt was a hard reset by holding down the power and volume at the same time. Nope, GPS still does not work.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: They are more finicky than I would like. Avoid water, wipe dry if it gets wet. But still the best phone, for me personally, on the market.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: I'm giving it 4 stars only b/c I have owned this D5803 a little more than a month, otherwise 5 stars. I'm very pleased with its performance. Camera is good if you manually set it to 20.7 MP. Not great in low light, but for that you would need Nokia Lumia which has no peers. If you own & don't like daylight picture quality then make sure you have manually set it. The default is 8 MP which is inferior. Great battery life! Fast response. For some reason the screen resists fingerprint marks like nothing I've ever seen. I've worked with hundreds of models and they all attract greasy prints, but not this one. If you are comparing with the Alpha, the Sony is much thicker and heavier but still comes in at a reasonable 129 grams. iPhone 6 is only other phone of this screen size that can compete with Z3 compact & Alpha, but the iPhone is heavier and thicker than both (especially the 6S - it's like a brick compared to the others!).Getting reliable LTE signal on T-Mobile in S. Florida. And having a 128GB memory slot is a real blessing. One thing - in my case, once connected to a WiFi network, when I leave that network I lose all network connectivity unless I turn off Wi-Fi first, and sometimes need to reboot. If I use the setting that allows the phone to "scan for WiFi networks, even when WiFi is Off" I will not get network signal. So if you have that issue, just be sure to disable that feature. Good night and luck!

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: the screen is only slightly bigger than the area my thumb can reach. I wanted a small phone and this is just about right. construction is solid and the screen is vivid with a durable screen. I plan on keeping this phone 3-4 years and am happy with the quality feel and dust/water resistant rating for life's mistakes. And in real daily use I get two days out of a battery charge, that is impressive for such a powerful processor. The camera is a nice plus, for me it's lower on my needs but at a dark concert event my phone took better pics than a friends motorola.I am disappointed in the stereo speakers. ring tones are surprisingly quieter than my old samsung brightside dumb phone, with music only having a improved midrange. I suppose its due to the water resistant housing/speakers. I was hoping for natural sound, one can't expect thumping base from a handheld device.p.s. I've had my sony z3 compact just shy of a month. and I highly recommend getting an aftermarket magnetic charging dock, much easier than using a fingernail to flip open the charging port.

Reviews: Read many reviews before purchasing, this phone is small but the software and features allow this phone to compete with any modern smartphone today. This phone has amazing battery life and super fluid response for games Web browsing and messaging. Only thing I've noticed is that for my personal usage, I will need to buy a micro SD card to store my Spotify tracks. This is easily the best phone I have owned and I have used Droids, Windows phones and IPhones before.Sony also has a very nice display and speakers packed into this phone. One last selling point for me is that Sony has packed in a magnetic charging port into the side of this phone allowing the user to do away with the bent pins of micro USB cables. While it is a separate purchase to get the magnetic charging cable I went ahead and bought 2 of them for the home and the car. WSKEN makes a model that supports Quick Charge 2.0 through magnetic charging if you're wanting that. Overall 11/10. When this phone breaks, I will definitely be an Xperia buyer from now on.

Reviews: Awesome phone. Perfect size, amazing battery life, great camera. But Sony, please Sony, why won't you get rid of your ugly skin and embrace stock android? Or at the very least let us root the phone without nuking the camera? While you can choose different themes to get rid of most of the Sony ugliness, you can't uninstall any of their apps. And for the love of god don't even think of rooting the phone to install your own ROM unless you REALLY know what you're doing. It nukes their custom drivers and puts the camera into a mode that takes pictures that are approximately as good as you would get using a potato.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty

I just think that the camera is not very good in showing the details in the image. However, I still recommend this phone to everyone because it has the same performance of the latest phones with low price.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: This is hands down the best phone if you're looking for something smaller than the 5 inch+ monsters flagships that are on the market today.The only competition on the market is the iPhone 6. So let's do a quick comparison. The Z3 Compact is about the same size as the iPhone 6, weights exactly the same, and has very similar screen in size and resolution. The Z3 has 4 cores running at 2.5 GHz with 2GB of RAM compared to iPhone 6's 2 cores running at 1.4 GHz with 1GB of RAM. Oh and it has a bigger (longer lasting) battery.Most impressive is the camera on the Z3 Compact. It is a 20MP at f/2.0 using a 1/2.3" chip. And it shoots 4K video (which the iPhone 6 does not do).Oh and it's waterproof! So when you drop it on the men's room floor, you can pick it up and just rinse it off while bystanders gape at you like you're insane. Or when your psycho girlfriend drops it in the pool (ala Taylor Swift "Blank Space"), as long as you fish it out in less than 30 minutes, you can text her using it and tell her it's over.And here's the kicker: It costs less than half the price of an iPhone 6. I've been a loyal Apple customer for a long time, and bought the first iPad on the day it came out. I'm sorry to say that I'm no longer willing to pay the Apple Tax.This phone works great on AT&T. First make sure you get the D5803 model. Then to get LTE data, you need to add the correct APN setting as instructed here: http://www.att.com/esupport/article.jsp?sid=KB424489&cv=820. You should have no problems. I sure didn't.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: The Z3 compact arrived and everything appears to look like a new device, box, screen cover and packaging. However the device is not assembled well and looks to be suspect as possibly not a new device from Sony.1. The outer bezel of the phone has an uneven gap around the edges2. When you squeeze the phone it flexes and clicks as if it is not tighly assembled3. It does not pass the water test application4. The phone was already configured, and has Chinese timezone and some Chinese app installed.I haven't contacted the seller yet, but I wanted to warn people asap as I think this may be a scam.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: The magnetic charger port didn't work.The rear glass cover opened up by the camera side only after 1 day.It's genuine Sony so I was suspecting this one could be factory refurbished.While repairing the back cover I was able to test the magnetic port leads. It is getting voltage but the phone is not charging. I did put a custom Marshmallow ROM on it. Could it be a software issue? Who knows.The charging cover flap did start to pop out on one side. It's not a big deal since I'm not taking it underwater. Just for those calls in the rain.Otherwise it's perfect. Love everything about the phone. Now I can finally install apps that require 4 core processors.4K video & 20mp photo are very nice. An excellent backup camera.Clear audio/music.1 star less for quality control.Maybe the back cover and sides should be one piece aluminum?Better side compartment cover?Gorilla glass display? (read reviews that had the issue)Which I think and hope it's fixed with Xperia Z5 and Xperia X models.If you going to get this phone. Get some extra tampered glass cover for the display. Maybe rear glass cover & double sided adhesive. Just in-case.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: EDIT: Review changed to one star.After five weeks with this phone, the phone still looking brand new, with no drops or water damage, this phone suddenly stopped working. When plugged in to power, a charging icon will appear for a few seconds, then go dark for ten seconds, and repeat that way, hour after hour. There is no way to turn the phone on. I've used Sony's support (and the PC Companion software), the reset button, all manner of booting described online, but with no success.While looking for help, I found that Sony's support site has a page for this phone, and the most popular thread in that support forum describes this problem. Apparently many other customers have the same problem. I asked Sony if I could pay them to repair the phone, which according to the other users, is either an old battery (from sitting in storage) or a defective motherboard. Sony answered that they no longer have the ability to repair this phone and will get back to me if they ever contract with a third party.My guess is that the magnetic charging port is part of the problem, but whatever the cause, this is the last phone someone should buy without a warranty. I took the gamble and lost, and that's on me, but I'll keep that in mind when I shop for phones in the future.This was, bar none, the worst experience I've ever had with Amazon.com. They deleted my review of a seller and when I asked why, explained that product reviews can't discuss the seller. As I watched, that seller's negative reviews all vanished. Be very careful buying international products from sellers, even if they have 100% positive reviews. It's possible that shady sellers are somehow abusing a complaint process to censor negative experiences. Just to be clear, this isn't the seller I got this phone from, but one that charged me and never sent the phone.----------------------------------------------------------------------------This is a pretty awesome value and a phone that is quite a bit different from most options out there today.The build quality felt great to me and as it's an android phone you probably have a good idea of what you're getting. I'll talk about the things that set this phone apart.The proprietary charging system is merely an option... you can use your normal USB cables if you open the little door on the upper left side of the phone. But the charging cradle is cheap and nifty, and the magnetic cable is a lot easier to fasten to the phone when driving or in the dark than jamming a USB cable in (which I always seem to try upside down the first time). I am disappointed that Sony doesn't include the charger or the proprietary cable. You only get the micro USB and the wall plug that could charge any modern phone.The phone is legit waterproof, and I've tested it. While I don't really plan to swim, I do work outdoors in weather occasionally and now I don't have to worry about the phone. The included headphones are really great and come with multiple earbud sizes, which is great for my tiny ears. They also have a little shirt clip, which is essential if you want to use the phone when jogging. The headphones have a mike and a button, of course, and the call/music quality is great, as expected from a Sony product.The playstation connectivity is terrific and dead simple to operate. I logged in with my Playstation Network info and the phone was able to automatically remote into my PS4 without any further setup. I paired a PS4 controller easily. You can also use the touchscreen, but for games like Dark Souls 3 you're going to want to use the controller. Unfortunately you cannot pair a PS3 controller with the phone. While there are options to use any Android phone to remote play, these require you to send your login information to a third party app, and that's a pretty big security risk and the reason you can see PSN accounts for sale. I'm very pleased with this feature.The phone came with a matte screen cover already slapped on, but with a little peel off ear sticking off the phone. While you're supposed to peel this off and then put your own screen protector on, I snipped off the ear and left the factory cover on. I mention this because it's working extremely well and putting those screen protectors on without bubbles beneath is a huge hassle.You're very limited in your phone case options. I'm using the Ringke Fusion, which is a thin, rubbery case. Because this case leaves the charging door exposed it's a little flimsy on the upper left side of the phone. It's merely good, not great. I also put a Rokform universal mount on the back and I highly recommend that option as you can then mount the phone to your car or bike without suction cups or flimsy clips. It also adds a little structure to the Ringke case, while keeping the phone nice and small.The screen's colors and clarity are awesome. Far beyond what my eyes can decipher. Because the screen is smaller, battery life is great too. I'm getting a little over two days on the phone, and it charges in a couple of hours on the cradle. The performance of the CPU is terrific. Much better than I expected from a phone design that's a year and a half old now. You could pay double the price and get the Z5 compact, but this phone's plenty powerful for even demanding applications. I noticed it gets warm if I play San Andreas, but the phone kept it up for hours with no trouble.I use my phone's camera all the time for work, and this camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. There's a dedicated shutter button that will get the camera app going in about a second, which is very convenient for me.The phone has some nice smart features, such as the option to unlock with a swipe if it's connected to my car's bluetooth or my watch, and to require a more secure login if not. You can get that kind of functionality on any android phone, but it's nice that it's just built in to the Sony version of Marshmallow android (which is the latest iteration, btw). This is also the best android phone I've had for the software environment. Sony has a very light touch on android, and lets you remove almost anything you didn't want. For example, I deleted Facebook before I even put my Sim card in. Other phones won't let you.And lastly, I love the size. I don't miss the huge screen when surfing the web or swyping on the keyboard. Movies still look great. The phone fits in my pocket more easily than the larger phones that dominate the 'nicer' class of smartphones. This is one of the few options for a really well made phone, with good power and a nice camera, that isn't huge. The smaller screen just works a lot better for me in day to day use.It's a huge shame these Xperia phones aren't more popular in the USA because they are exceptional options. I am pleased with the phone but deeply frustrated with Amazon.com and with the first seller I attempted to purchase this phone through (although the seller I eventually used did a good job). Please be very cautious buying this phone or any other phone shipping from China as it is clear to me that Amazon is deleting the majority of negative seller feedback and you are not getting any more security with this purchase than you would from Ebay. I observed my negative seller feedback and other shoppers feedback deleted despite being completely within the norm for earnest seller feedback, but if I go into detail in my product review Amazon will remove the review (I know this because they did this a few days ago). Just be careful. I love the phone itself and the five stars is for the phone and no other aspect of the shopping experience.

Reviews: The phone which they claimed to be brand new turned out to be refurbished using non-genuine parts, however these guys at ZBFatima did an impressive job making it look and feel legit so I bumped my rating up to 3 stars in appreciation of their effort. Next time please try to get the name right (It’s “Z3 compact”, not “Z3 mini”) and correct the misspellings on the packaging, thank you.P1: The back panel of the unit. Notice how the logo on the fake one(upper left) is noticeably darker and thicker than the original.P2: The manual that comes with the unit appears to be made for another phone from the Sony-Ericsson era as it features screenshots from the old android 2.3 and referred Google Play as “Android Market”. It also mentioned about some features that are non-existent on this model such as physical menu buttons and HDMI port.P3: They’ve even gone to the trouble of making a printed screen protector for added authenticity. Unfortunately they just couldn’t be bothered to get the name right (it says “Xperia Z3 Mini” instead of “Xperia Z3 Compact”). And it’s actually Xperia Z1 that’s featured on the illustration.P4: As with other refurbished phones I’ve previously experienced with, the identification tag (which is a plastic slip you can pull out underneath the bottom flap) is missing.P5: For added hilarity, the “DIGITAL” is misspelled as "DIGITRL"

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: The phone is great. It has great performance, looks very nice, etc. My problem is with the quality of its construction. I take excellent care of my electronics, and this phone wasn't the exception. I bought a protecting case for it, I have never dropped it or hit it, sat on it, put it under pressure inside my pocket, or abused it in any way. Yet, only 4 months after I bought it the headphone jack plug started do get wide for some reason, and soon after it stopped working. I bought a bluetooth headset, which I've been using ever since.But the worse came only a month ago (13 months after purchase). A full vertical sector of the digitizer stopped working, out of nowhere. The screen is in perfect condition, but for whatever reason the touchscreen underneath just isn't working properly anymore. I attached a picture of the hardware test I did, so you can see the size of that sector. There are also pictures of the phone itself, so you can see there is no damage at all.I've also found a number of people complaining of very similar problems in tech support blogs. The display now behaves very erratically all the time, which I find ridiculous, seeing how everyone around me seems to have a samsung with a cracked screen which nonetheless detects their finger with no problem whatsoever.I'm very disappointed, and I have to say, this is the second out of 5 Sony (Sony-Ericsson) phones I've had throughout the past decade, which has malfunctioned within 18 months after purchase, despite how careful I am with them. In this particular case the problem can be solved by buying a new screen, which costs around $50, with the caveat that the phone will no longer be waterproof.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty

Several months after the ~$200 in repairs, the phone again fell and got a small crack in the screen that again rendered the touchscreen inoperable.I don't expect this to be a rugged phone but I do expect it to handle everyday wear and tear, including surviving modest falls when it slips from my hand.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: I've been using (mainly) Sony Ericsson/Sony Xperia phones since i was 14, so needless to say 10+ years later i have acquired a bit of brand loyalty that has been tested many times over. I bought this phone as a replacement for my Xperia E3, though it wasn't my first choice. After much research and comparisons between the Xperia E4g, M4 Aqua, and this phone, The Z3 Compact won my favor to at least try out. Now that i've had the phone for roughly a month, i must say THIS PHONE IS A FRICKING TANK!!!!!Pros-Awesome battery life and charge speed-Great Speaker-Smooth Xperia UI-Phone is a year old with awesome amount of support (from sony and modders)-Custom ROMs (YES!!!!!!!!)-Fast With great amount of storage and ram out the box (i still recommend getting at least a 4gb micro sd just incase.)-WATERPROOF (I Drop Stuff)-SHATTER-PROOF SCREEN (I REALLY Drop Stuff hehe)-LOLLIPOP UPGRADE!!!!!-SIZE 4.6" (Not into the whole 5 inch screen craze, prefer smaller phones)Cons-Bloatware (like always)-Camera resolution could be betterI practice/teach Parkour and love to have music on me and take pics of areas and people. I needed a phone that would allow that without me having to worry about breaking it (as much) but also need more processing speed/power and storage space for everyday and business applications.......and i couldn't be more pleased, especially after rooting it and adding a cfw!!!! I definitely recommend this phone to anyone because it's worth the price and i honestly feel this is the best Xperia Smartphone to date.

Had a minor issue with the screen not turning off but a restart resolved that. Right now facing data connectivity issues but I usually restart it or disable/enable data. Still unclear why that happens. Am using t-mobile. The battery lasts me for 2 days on one full charge with regular usage (using wifi nearly the entire day with low brightness). Sleek feel to hold in hand (although I use it with a case). Running low on memory - about 75% (12gb) because I have a lot of pictures (about 600) and some heavy apps like spotify, facebook and messenger.

Reviews: Arrived in perfect condition!OK its NOT supported by ANY US carriers. BUT it runs fine on T-Mobile LTE. Because it is NOT supported by them there is NO phone calling over wi-fi. I explained to their support they are shooting themselves in the foot: I will just overuse their data network for my email & browsing! The other downside is that the Z3 Compact shows up as unknown on your T-Mobile account.The screen is fantastic. Don't let the 720dpi deter you. On a screen this size it is very clear. YouTube plays great with its stereo but quiet speakers. Phone clarity is excellent & loud. The camera at 20+ is great. Sony's built in email is good enough to not to need K-9. Itś Calendar is removable. A+ is the way to go.Came set for German but easily switched to English. Mobile networks has to be switched from "euinternet". Just type in the same settings from another T-Mobile phone.

Product.Name: SONY XPERIA Z3 COMPACT D5803 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) INTERNATIONAL MODEL- WHITE No-Warranty
Reviews: What a beautiful phone seriously. The screen size of an iPhone 6 but only the physical size of an iPhone 5 in your hand!! The design is BEAUTIFUL and I was worried about the side "rubbers" before I got them because they might feel cheap but I was wrong.This is every bit of a premium smartphone from Sony you'd expect and the rubber doesn't make it any lesser than Z2 phones I've held. Of course it's loaded with a lot of extra crap from Sony but you can just ignore those.The camera is great with a lot of manual settings if you like that -- but personally after numerous comparisons, I still feel like iPhone 6's (or even iPhone 5's) is slightly better. Maybe that's just cause I am used to seeing the images on those phones, or just the fact that it's so simple to take a photo on iPhone and have it turn out great than to have to tweak all the manual settings.Overall it is what it is, it's an Android phone just too bad I can't get the newest android L on this yet to see how much better it is. You still get a lot more satisfaction out of using an iPhone if you're an iPhone user already but if your'e starting fresh into the smartphone world this is definitely an awesome purchase.NOTEAfter reading other reviews too, i WILL AGREE that the charging dock seems "necessary" as you don't want to be opening the flaps every time you want to charge your phone. I also fear overtime it may wear out the flap and make it not water proof any more (my actually went a bit coo coo after dipping it in a cup of water for 5minutes on the 2nd day......so back to my iPhone it is)

Reviews: I read so many good things about this phone. Battery life is great but most everything else sucked. Camera was terrible especially the front one which took horribly grainy photos even in non low light situations. It couldn't take photos underwater because the touch screen wouldn't respond when it was under water. The first one I ordered had been opened and came with a different plug and want the standard American plug or adapter. The next one I got hadn't been opened but also didn't come with an American plug although it had an I'll fitting adapter.The biggest kicker was that i couldn't send or receive MMS messages with this phone on T-Mobile. They sent the issue to their engineering department, we went over the APN settings time and again and they finally figured out it was that this phone couldn't send them for some reason. Couldn't send snapchat photos at first either although that resolved after some updates and restarts to the phone.Thank you to Amazon for having a great return policy because this phone was nothing like the reviews

I sent to Sony, they did the tests and said it was my fault! LESS THAN 3 MONTHS and I just threw my money away. Reviews: I gave this phone a great review a few months ago and my opinion on the phone hasn't really changed; make no mistake about it: this is a great phone. All of its functions are superb and I felt quite happy about it....but it's not the phone I'm going to gripe about in this review...After nine months of continuous and satisfactory performance, the phone can now no longer connect to call signals. It turns out the unlocked bands on the phone only last for so long. I use it in Colombia (Southamerica) and the phone is supposed to be unlocked, and it was for the first nine months of use, but now I am forced to spend about $50 bucks on having the phone unlocked again through a tedious 2 week process. It is apalling that Amazon lets this type of company sell phones that are supposed to be permanent unlocked and really aren't.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: Really superb phone wiith dual sim capability. With a requirement to travel internationally on occasions, I find the dual sim handset a real bonus to allow me to have a local sim (lower local cost calls and data) and my 'home' sim in one familliar handset along with all my favourite apps and features. I researched the market and the Z3 D6633 was the one which covered the required LTE frequencies in the UK and my most likely destination countries. (There are other model numbers of the Z3 Dual which have more market specific frequencies) I did look at the Z3+ and Z5 Dual, but overheating issues with the Z3+ and perceptably bulkier design on the Z5 encouraged me to try to get hold of one of the few remaining Z3 Dual handsets. After being messed arround by a supplier based in Hong Kong, I found the D6633 on Amazon.com and it was dispatched from the USA and with me in just over a week.Having previously had a Sony Z1 Compact, the Z3 Dual is everything I could have hoped for - great screen, fantastic music with the compatible noise cancelling headphones (at under £30, also from Amazon), build quality etc......If you can still get hold of one of these handsets, just do it - you will not regret it.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: I was in the market for a dual-SIM, flagship Android phone early in the year 2015. After much research it seemed the Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 was the ticket. Performance is what you'd expect of a flagship in the later half of 2014 so I won't detail that as it's thoroughly reviewed/documented across the interwebs. I will, however, detail my experience with the shortcomings of this phone. Begin...Upon delivery, unwrap and initial inspection, the first first issue became evident. The adhesive tape that Sony used to seal the back glass to the phone is insufficient for the task of waterproofing. It was lifting from the chassis near the bottom of the phone and any attempts to press and reseal were futile at best. So much for the IPX-blah blah rating. As this comes shipped WITHOUT warranty for those of us in the states, I was stuck with trying to figure out how to fix this. Further research into this particular issue yielded a product by the name of Sugru (you'll want to add this to your cart as well if you buy this phone). Ordered, applied carefully, let cure for 24 hours, problem solved... UNTIL the back glass inevitably cracks and warrants a replacement ($8+/- here on Amazon). At this point you then have to pry the cemented glass off with a chisel as the Sugru means business, resulting in many glass splinters and shards everywhere (be sure to wear eye protection and lay down adhesive under your workspace!). I figure the average user will be in need of this operation at least two times a year... or more.This phone is just too slippery and delicate. As previous reviews mention, the thing has a mind of it's own. It's so flat on it's major surfaces that if laid flat it'll slide due to the air pockets it creates between itself and the surface it's laid upon. Who needs a ouija board when your Z3 is possessed from the factory!? You'll be a hit at parties, for sure. And if the surface is anything but level, it'll slide off the edge of the world to a lower center of gravity. If the fall is anything above moderate, the glass WILL crack. Reminds of the radical shift in iPhone design from the 3 to the 4. Don't buy this phone for aesthetics if you plan to put a case on it. That's blasphemous to the design of the phone, but necessary if you want to keep it unscathed for longer than the 6+ months I did.I have since upgraded to the Moto X Pure Edition (2015) as I no longer have a need for dual-SIM functionality and far more satisfied with that phone. Nice job with creating a glamorous, but disappointing phone, Sony. Here's hoping subsequent iterations of the Xperia Z line are more durable and robust.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: Excellent SmartPhone!! 2 Sim capability for maximum connectivity, great performance and camera, hasn't been laggy or crashed since the first day

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black

However, this thing is WAY to delicate, I have dropped it 3 times, all three were from pants pocket height, first time dented the corner and chipped the glass, the second made the phone freeze up and require a hard reset, the third landed on the top corner and cracked the touch screen down the middle, and unlike other phones that can be used with a cracked screen, this phone's touch screen stopped working on 90% of the screen. Find a good bumper case and you'll love this phone.

I already know Xperia Z3, which is an excelent device. The problem in here is not over the product. In the label of the box where the IMEI number is, i can read "2G /3G/LTE AR, EN FA,FR", which looks to me the countries it was designed for. This information does not match the description of the product in here. Also, after printing the order summary I found that the covered bands differ from which you can read in the product description page. I am returning the phone.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: Very nice phone, super high rez camera, bright, big screen, light, thin, well made, nice looking. From a spec standpoint this stands up to the iPhone 6 with a much better camera. If you are not hooked on iOS, this is a worthy consideration. This is the nicest phone I have owned (Android, iOS, Windows, Apple, HTC, Samsung, BB, Nokia). Updated to Lollipop right after turning it on, so be prepared for an hour(ish) upgrade potentially depending on when you buy it. I travel between Asia and US and the dual SIM is a must and works thoughtlessly on this model.I bought the magnetic charger adapter and that makes charging much easier as you don't have to fumble with a tiny connector. Get the plug close and it is magnetically drawn into place.Update: I took this on vacation in France and I cannot say enough about the camera. In our group, we had people carrying Samsung, HTC and Apple phones and this one consistently took the best pictures in each and every condition.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: Quick summary: after about 1 month, the phone is great and has exceeded expectations. Below are some details on my experience.The phone came in a package that was not sealed, even thought the description was new. It appeared to have been opened. The phone itself looked to be in new condition so I decided to give it a chance.The pros:1. took it to ATT and all worked just fine with the network2. The phone is super fast, blazing.3. The connection is strong and clear, to the point where I was wondering if the Sony could be this good, or was my old phone just so bad and slow etc.4. The battery is excellent, Sony claims 2 days. I tested it. I went 42 hours with my normal moderate use. I had GPS and wifi on. At 42 hours I had 14% of the battery left and I decided to charge it. So I guess it is possible to get to 48 hrs with no charge esp with light use.5. The size is fine, I was concerned it would be too big. No problem, with one hand you can still comfortably do everything.6. It has dual sim which i intend to use traveling, but have not done that yet, I hope it all works fine.The cons, or at least things that caught the attention:1. As mentioned, the package did come open, not sure why.2. The material said it was made in Hong Kong, but materials were in English and Farsi, a little strange, cannot imagine it was made for the iranian market!?!?3. This model is not sold officially in the US so I still cannot find a case that fits exactly right. I found another Z3 case that fits the phone itself, but not all holes line up. I had to use an exacto knife to enlarge the charging hole. Other than this, the case works ok for now.4. Finally, the Sony software conncetivity suite does not seem that great. I probably will not even use it.5. I read reviews about it being slippery. This is true. The front and back are so fine and smooth that I was always worried about dropping it. It does seem delicate. But one I got the case that concern went away, it seems fine.In sum, the phone is super fast and the battery is really good. I am not a iphone fan and would take this over an iphone any day. Well worth the $620 I paid.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: I have been using this phone for a few months now - I did not want to write a review until I had used it extensively.The phone has a nice big screen and is bright in daylight, which is nice.The phone is NOT a U.S. model, so the normal Experia case will not fit - order one anyway (because the phone is very slippery) and then expect to take a razor and make a slight modification where the charge port is.Other people have posted reviews about the phone's water-proof-edness, with mixed results - I have NOT submerged my phone in water, or taken it into the pool with me - primarily because it's a cell phone, and that would be retarded - do not take your "cell phone" swimming with you - seriously? No phone is "water proof" - despite what Sony advertises (now back to the review)The dual sim function is nice (which is why I bought the phone) and the other reason I bought THIS phone is because it is the ONLY flagship android phone that works on AT&T's LTE network ... I did days of research and coordinated with AT&T customer service to make sure I was getting a phone that uses their LTE - and it does. You WILL need to call customer service and have THEM update your carrier settings before it will work and they have to flip some digital switch on their end as well - so don't be frustrated until you jump through their hoopsThe reception on SIM 2 is crappy - no other way around it ... it drops calls (frequently - at least 2-4 times a week, if not more) and that is frustrating. I think the antenna for the SIM cards is pretty crappy at best. I do NOT get the signal strength I did from ANY of my past iPhones, and the antenna for SIM 2 is especially bad - I often have to leave buildings to get good call clarity - which has not been an issue since the early 90's ... ugThe phone call and speakerphone volumes are not good ... rather quiet ... disappointing - I have good hearing, but if I did not, I would throw this phone into the river because it's too quiet (wait - it's "waterproof" - I would throw it into hot lava instead).This might sound petty, but to unlock the screen using a pin, you must enter your pin, THEN press the ok button ... on the iPhone, you only had to enter your pin and it would automatically unlock ... so this extra button push is irritatingThe battery does NOT last for 2+ days ... I read a lot of reviews about how great the battery life is - and it definitely lasts all day, but I would never get 2 days out of mine (like, ever).There are also a lot of great reviews about the camera ... and with digital cameras there is a lot of jargon to weed through before you understand what all of those numbers mean - but as a whole, this camera is really no better than my iPhone 5's camera ... it's not strikingly betterIF you're planning to switch your SIM cards in/out on a regular basis, this phone will not be convenient to do that - you have to slide out a fragile tray on the side of the phone and carefully take them in/out ... after a while this tray might break if you're not really carefulOne big disappointment is that you cannot 'assign' which contacts get called/texted with which SIM card ... the phone makes you choose which SIM card EVERY TIME you call/text - this is annoying when you use voice/internet commands to call a number - ie: "ok google ... call mom..." - it will NOT just call mom ... it will then make you choose which SIM card to call mom with, and if your phone is locked, it will not call mom at all until you unlock the phone and select which SIM to use ... all of this hassle makes the voice command take just as long as manually calling from a favorites listHope this review helps

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6633 Factory Unlocked, International Version, Black
Reviews: I bought a Sony Xperia Z3 (dual SIM) model D6633 phone from Amazon. I received it in a timely manner and have no issues with Amazon concerning the phone or shopping experience..The only oddities are it came with an international plug and lacks a setting for American English, which is not a major problem as the Canadian English setting works well for me and I can easily buy 110 volt plugs that fit U.S. type wall outlets.Most of the time (after finally getting it properly configured) my Xperia D6633 works well with both my U.S. T-Mobile SIM and my Mexican Movistar SIM. Both these carriers offer 4G LTE data in their respective country--and I can get it when my Xperia D6633 is properly configured. (More about that later.)Most dual SIM phones are not 4G LTE capable and most that are 4G LTE capable, unlike the Xperia D6633, are 4G LTE capable on only one of the two SIM chips. I would not buy a phone that is not 4G LTE capable. Because the Xperia D6633 was the only dual SIM phone that I could find that is 4G LTE capable on both SIM chips I think this is the best dual SIM phone on the market at this time; however, I am not happy with the way 4G LTE works on my Xperia--or on any other dual SIM phone as they all share a common problem (described below).For years I carried two phones. I am not sure if switching to a dual SIM phone will (as I hoped) make my life better. Due to the problems detailed below I may go back to carrying two phones. (Or I may switch to a single SIM phone and use Telcel America which has coverage in both the U.S. and Mexico as well as get--from somebody like Keep Calling--a virtual Mexican number for use by my Mexican friends and customers. (I fear, however, this would not provide me the data coverage that is available--if I am willing to jump through the necessary hoops--that having both a US and Mexican 4G LTE capable SIM makes possible.)On the Xperia Z3 model D6633 only one SIM at a time can be used for data coverage and the user manually designates which of the two SIM chips is to provide the data coverage. So every time I cross the border I have to manually change the data setting (unless I want to always be on data roaming in one of the two countries where I use the phone). What I want are "set and forget" options. I want to either be able to designate one SIM to always provide data coverage (even when roaming) or to be able to configure the phone so that the data connection will automatically switch to the other SIM when a SIM enters data roaming territory. Without this option I must manually change the data SIM selection every time I cross the border, which is a tiresome experience. (It is possible that my gripe is actually a result of my lack of understanding about how to configure the phone's data connection settings and if so I owe Sony a star. If somebody knows how to do this please post the procedure as I have searched for this information and have not been able to find it and thus do not think it exists.) I am deducting a star for the lack of this option.The Xperia Z3 miniUSB charging port is on the left side of the phone, not at the bottom where it is on most cell phones. I find this makes talking on the phone while it is charging very uncomfortable.Equally annoying is became the charging port is on the side instead of at the bottom a standard Xperia Z3 protective case will not fit the Xperia Z3 model D6633 because both SIM chips as well as the charging port are housed under the charging port cover. This makes the D6633 charging port cover larger than it is on the standard Xperia Z3. The end result is that I have to remove the phone's protective case to charge the phone using a USB cable as well as to remove the protective cover to connect the phone to a computer using a USB cable (because good protective cases made specifically for the D6633 are as hard to find as hen's teeth) if I want to use a protective case. Again, annoyingly, to charge the phone or to connect it to a computer I must either remove the protective case or go without a good, protective case .So that I do not have to remove the protective case every time I want to charge the phone I bought a charging cradle and it works--if one is willing to wait overnight to charge the phone and spend the extra money for a charging cradle. (This problem would not exist if Sony put the charging port on the bottom of the phone as most manufactures do.) I am deducting a star because of the design (1) makes it uncomfortable to talk on the phone while it is charging and (2) makes me either go without a good protective over or remove the protective cover to charge the phone as well as connect it to a computer using a USB cable.Thus far my experience is dual standby dual SIM phones (like the D6633) eat up more battery life than do single SIM phones. The battery life of my Xperia D6633 I would describe as only adequate on a good day. I usually make it through the day without having to charge the phone, which is a far cry from the hype I heard about only having to charge it every two or three days. When it does not make it through the day it starts shutting down things like W-Fi. The problem is what is turned off is not automatically turned back on after the phone is charged. (Which means things like Wi-Fi may not be working without your knowing it.)I mostly use a phone to talk and text; I also spend more time talking on my phone each day than does the average person. Since I am neither a techie nor a power user I will let others comment on features like the camera and GPS as they are features I seldom, if ever, use. The screen resolution is most adequate for my needs, which are less than somebody who says watches Netflix. The same for the speakers as I do not do things like listen to music on my phone, although I do wish the speaker had a little more volume as sometimes I do not hear it ring while driving or when some other loud background noise is present. (A problem that probably has much to do with my hearing as with the phone itself.)If, like me, you are not a techie try to find a person who knows something about dual SIM phones to set it up. After installing SIM1 the phone worked fine, however, the person who installed my SIM2 made some fatal changes to my SIM1 settings. When the person who first installed my SIM1 re-set the SIM1 selections the same thing happened to my SIM2 settings. It took a while to find somebody who understood how to properly configure both SIM chips. (I suggest you make write down all the APN and other such settings after each successful SIM installation.)Some, but not all, options are be configured differently for each SIM. For example, each SIM can be set to use a different ring tone.Be warned that not all apps work with two SIM chips installed. For example, Google Voice can receive incoming calls when two SIM chips are installed, but cannot be used to make outgoing calls when two SIM chips are installed. The text messaging app that comes with the D6633 works with both SIM chips installed, but not the text messaging app that I prefer. Etc. The reason is just before placing a call or sending a text a dialog box appears asking which SIM you want to use. Some apps can handle this interruption, others cannot.I wish Sony would make a comparable Xperia Z3 dual SIM compact phone. I prefer the smaller form factor and although I have adjusted to the larger size I still wish it was available in a smaller size.I am, no doubt, a heavy grader, especially since overall the Xperia D6633 works reasonably well. (However, when I spend $500.00 on something I grumble if I do not get exactly what I want, which is the case with my Xperia Z3 dual SIM phone.) I think the Sony Xperia D6633 is probably the best dual SIM phone on the market; however, I am not sure getting a dual SIM phone was an improvement over carrying two phones.

Reviews: Don't waste your money. This phone started out working great. Snappy processor, quick browsing, able to handle many tasks at once. I'd love to tell you all the other details about this phone that make it great. Soon my experience changed.After one month the screen began acting funny. The colors appeared washed out. Soon the screen would only work occasionally. After 2 lousy months, many hours on the phone with Sony and many headaches, I have a $500 brick. It turns out that this phone is not covered by warranty.Having read other reviews confirming this I feel foolish. It turns out that there are tons of issues with the screen on this phone (just do some quick research). I got burned. I will never do business with this retailer or Sony EVER again.I would also like to add:Terribly long shipping time.Box was not sealed when it arrived.Comes with EU charger.No in store support.Accessories for this phone are few and mostly low quality.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) GSM international model - Copper "No Warranty"
Reviews: Great little phone and a good alternative to others.Pros:+ waterproof, dustproof, I wouldn't go diving in it but it helps with the occasional spill.+ android and all of those benefits+ external charging (although yet to be tested by me since I have heard some horror stories)+ nice bright screen+ few android tweaks to help the end user experience (mostly the gesture to just pick up the phone to ear and it will automatically pickup)Cons:- really slick back, it will slip from your hands or something smooth and uneven. Case in point, a smooth glass table that was slightly off level, I could see my phone sliding down.- weak external speaker output- I don't like opening a door everytime to charge and I don't want to use the magnetic charger- obviously a niche phone so not too many accessories- I don't like the camera performance- biggest gripe is the overheating. Yes if you want to shoot some video or camera for extending times, the phone will overheat and shut the application down. That's not cool since this is supposedly a camera centric phone.- due to sealed design, no battery replacementOverall, yes there are some drawbacks but still I like this phone.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) GSM international model - Copper "No Warranty"
Reviews: This phone I bought for my wife, she didn't try and use it straight away as she had only just renewed a month on her previous plan and she was changing carrier. Finally she tried to change carrier using this international unlocked version, she had trouble and contacted the carrier, they spent days to a week trying to figure out what and why it wouldn't connect. She finally left it and we tried again, once more the carrier couldn't connect and I called sony, eventually they told me this 'International' version which is unlocked will ONLY work....... In Japan!!!! Great, so a word of warning to anyone buying an unlocked phone, check immediately to see if it is compatible with where you live, I purchased the exact same phone and it connected straight away, no one knows why mine works and hers doesn't. Upset and now have to spend another $500 to get her another phone.

Reviews: Overall it's a great phone, works well like any android phone. (All of the advantages which i agree with are already written in previous reviews)I did have a little trouble getting used to a few annoying stuff, for example: I rearranged my photos in new folders using my phone, and then later i attached my phone to my computer, and all of the folders I created were gone, only the ones i had originally put on my phone through my computer were there. In addition to that, every time i go into my photo library i see all of my photos on my phone unorganized, and i have to click on view in folders every time. One last thing is I highly recommend you apply a glass screen protector immediately as you receive your phone. I only applied the regular screen protector I had received with the phone, and 2 weeks after using it, the screen cracked at the top (no idea how it happened), and then I couldn't use the screen at all above the crack.

Reviews: phone is authentic and doesnt have any carriers or networks logo anywhere. just a pure standard xperia z3 that you would find in sony store or any other phone store that carriers sony. one thing though is that i think it was made for china/chinese region so it does contain several chinese apps and couple of functions are in chinese. Neverheless, this phone is unlocked so it will most likely work anywhere. the chinese functions will naturally and automatically change to your prefered language once you put a sim and have the phone working with any network provider. as for the chinese apps, you can just unistall/delete them. the phone is slim, nice and solid looking, wide screen that's great for watching, it has a lot of good features.some cons that i found from z3:-minimal audio volume (if you love listening to music a lot, this could be a big downside. volume doesnt go that high)-not functioning well...or at all, and just freeze when battery is about 5 or 4%-when the phone is using high energy/power to play a video, games, app etc... the backside of the phone heats up-it takes a while for the battery to charge up completely-probably need a camera app to take really good pictures. standard camera doesnt take great photos even if the phone has 20.7 mp
