Reviews: Note: I have had this phone for 3 days.I bought this phone expecting it to be what reviewers and the manufacturer said it would be. Well, i was very dissappointed.First letdown is the speakers. IThe speakers have a very irritating screechy sound if put at a high volume, which doesnt happen with other phones. Second, the camera does not focus well or take moving pictures well. I had the xperia SP, n honestly it took better moving pictures and it was much more simpler. Third, there is a lot of static when it comes to taking pictures. Most of the time, my pictures are filled with "Static". Generally speaking, its aa semi-fast processor. I use it for some social media, some pictures and for messaging/calling. Thats all.rate: 4/10.UPDATE: i ordered a replacement and nke that z3 is messed up too. Maybe its the seller selling faulty goods, or just Sony. The replacement disconnects 4g every 2 minutes which is really aggravating. I never had this problem with any other phone.Basically: dont buy this phoneThe good things are the feel, the speed, the battery life, the simplicity.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE.I bought 2 and both of them do not work anymore.Reason: Although the Sony Xperia Z3 is waterproof....these phones are not.Both my phones got water in them as we where taking pictures in pool.Now I know why it was written clear...NO WARRANTY.

Reviews: I loved this phone untill the digitizer broke and it became a brick. I will say it worked ok, not great with t-mobile here in puerto rico. the battery wouldnt last as advertised, probably because it was looking for signal all the time. People said it would bend, and that it would get too hot... personally i didnt experience this. It remained snappy for as long as it worked. Can confirm the amount of megapixel doesnt make a big difference, the pictures looked liked that of any other flagship phone. You have to use a case with this one, its super slippery. My headphone broke after a few months, and would only play music from a precise angle. The display looked very beautiful.

I dont think is the Phone, i mean is the supplier Who sell this fake products. The back sheet got broken after two days of use, the screen is blue, there are not real colors when taking a picture, the screen doesnt turn off after some time, it is always on. The battery Last like 4 hours if you send messages or talk. Dont buy it!!

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: Amazing phone!The camera is the best phone camera i've ever seen. Shoots practically in the dark, super wide angle, resolution of course is crazy too. Very nice to be able to push a hard button from any position to activate too. Super nice.Being Android 4.4. also allows installation of the google camera with photosphere and a lot of nice processing.Everything else works really good too. The sound is great, the screen is great..... layout is almost barebones android - no annoying bloatware (except a very nice sony walkman). No need to mess with flashing ROMs (i fried a Samsung Note 2 previously installing custom ROM to get rid of the samsung bloatware). Overall - extremely happy with this phone!Note that the 6653 does NOT work with Tmobile's LTE in Boston. Could work in other areas but not sure. If you want Tmobile/ATT LTE it's better to get the 6603 model.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: There's a problem with the microphone. From the first day we had it, people I called were noticing the issue. Whether I'm using an app or the phone , everyone says that I sound muffled--it sounds like I have my face pressed against something, or I'm speaking through something over the microphone. Even holding the phone a few inches away from me doesn't help. I've heard it myself and can tell that the microphone on my phone is rather unclear. I've made sure it wasn't a connection issue. Again, this was a noticeable problem from the first day we had it.The speakers work fine, so I am able to hear the other end of the call perfectly fine, but calling has become nearly impossible now unless I use an external microphone, be it through the earphones that came with the phone or otherwise - the microphone is still an issue even when the call is on speakerphone.

That resulted in the back of the phone completely ruined. The phone does not work anymore, except for certain occasions only, when it's in the mood. Other than that I'm phoneless.Worst choice of phone I ever made. Sony never again. Sorry.

Reviews: It's not the D6653, It's D6603.d6603 works in Chile, but the problem I had was that this particular phone does NOT work signal of 3G and 4G, only 2G.. I went to Sony customer service and they opened it, they discover that the BATTERY was not original, it showed that the battery was used before , the back cover of the phone was thinner than a original Z3 cover..Conclusion, this smartphone is a REFURBISHED cell phone, the battery is not original, and the back case is not original as well.Do not buy this phone if you live in Latin america, the battery life will drain faster, and you will get insane trying to fix the 3G and 4G, the seller should tell that this phone is not original, and has all that cons that I said before.

Reviews: The cellphone has technical problems and i can't use it. Is damaged.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: I purchased this phone because I was moving out of country and wanted an unlocked phone. When it arrived I could not put a sim card into it because the tray that the sim card sits it was missing. I waited on Sony for more than 8 weeks to replace that part. During that time I used the phone exclusively on WiFi and it performed great. When my service was finally fulfilled by Sony I plugged in my sim card in my new fancy tray and it would not connect to any mobile network. Tried factory reset; nothing. Reset software; nothing. It is here I found out that the phone itself was defective I went back to Sony for repair/replacement and was rejected because no Sony phones manufactured in France are covered in their current warranty programs for this model. This may all be bad luck. I missed the warranty policy change by two weeks(waiting for the tray...) I may have purchased a lemon, but buyer beware.

One initial disappointing feeling was this particular model doesn't support 4g on the At&t network but after battle testing it for a couple weeks I have found it is just as fast. It takes great pictures in and out of water with tons of cool editing and and customizing features. Battery life is unbelievable. Having had tons of phones over the past few years,this is the best so far. Keep it up Sony.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: Hello Guys in this short review I try to summarize all good and bad things about this phone. First of all the OS android updates up to 5.1.1 so it stays up to date. The Software is OK although there is again some bloatware but at least you can uninstall it. One Missing feature is definitely a taskmaster for resources and uninstalling of programs. The Hardware is really good the processor and graphic card areable to show high-quality without any large. The camera makes good photos but with bad light or too long photos the background turns uncolored. The battery can be used for 5 hours of gaming and one day or more if you Just use texting programs. The Speakers are okay but not as good as the from the HTC one m9. The buttons are good placed and easy to reach and one hand use isnt difficult. Nice feature: you can open the camera with locked phone if u need to make a few photos fast. This shouldn't be a professional review because that's what newspapers are for but at least I can recommend it especially because it's good p/l relation. I hope that this gave you at least a little overview.

Reviews: Note: I have had this phone for 3 days.I bought this phone expecting it to be what reviewers and the manufacturer said it would be. Well, i was very dissappointed.First letdown is the speakers. IThe speakers have a very irritating screechy sound if put at a high volume, which doesnt happen with other phones. Second, the camera does not focus well or take moving pictures well. I had the xperia SP, n honestly it took better moving pictures and it was much more simpler. Third, there is a lot of static when it comes to taking pictures. Most of the time, my pictures are filled with "Static". Generally speaking, its aa semi-fast processor. I use it for some social media, some pictures and for messaging/calling. Thats all.rate: 4/10.UPDATE: i ordered a replacement and nke that z3 is messed up too. Maybe its the seller selling faulty goods, or just Sony. The replacement disconnects 4g every 2 minutes which is really aggravating. I never had this problem with any other phone.Basically: dont buy this phoneThe good things are the feel, the speed, the battery life, the simplicity.

Reviews: phone is authentic and doesnt have any carriers or networks logo anywhere. just a pure standard xperia z3 that you would find in sony store or any other phone store that carriers sony. one thing though is that i think it was made for china/chinese region so it does contain several chinese apps and couple of functions are in chinese. Neverheless, this phone is unlocked so it will most likely work anywhere. the chinese functions will naturally and automatically change to your prefered language once you put a sim and have the phone working with any network provider. as for the chinese apps, you can just unistall/delete them. the phone is slim, nice and solid looking, wide screen that's great for watching, it has a lot of good features.some cons that i found from z3:-minimal audio volume (if you love listening to music a lot, this could be a big downside. volume doesnt go that high)-not functioning well...or at all, and just freeze when battery is about 5 or 4%-when the phone is using high energy/power to play a video, games, app etc... the backside of the phone heats up-it takes a while for the battery to charge up completely-probably need a camera app to take really good pictures. standard camera doesnt take great photos even if the phone has 20.7 mp

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: The phone is fantastic! I sell cars and use it while I am out on the lot to bring up specs and pricing on vehicles, I use it all day long non-stop and at the end of the night it is still above 50%The battery on the phone is fantastic and with Stamina Mode enabled it can last two days with ease. The overall build of the phone is awesome as well, with it's smooth edges and large screen the phone will stand out among the iPhone 6 plus. I have my phone paired with a Moto360 smartwatch and my car most of the day and it has hardly any impact on the phones battery.The camera is also fantastic with amazing photos and great sound and video it makes taking pictures of cars and doing videos of the a snap.The processors on this phone also keep it ahead of the game, everything loads fast and efficient on the phone and even as I switch back and forth with apps it keeps it all a breeze.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: Very reliable phone and great for documenting your adventure. If you travels and into outdoor activity then you'll need a reliable phone to document your life adventures. This phone has great hardware and software support to handle all the exciting lifestyle there is. With mico-sd expansion slot you'll never run out of storage. I was hesitant at first but the phone performed wonderfully underwater and I was able to get great shot while snorkeling in hawaii.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 D6653 GSM Cellphone Unlocked, International Version No Warranty, Black
Reviews: The seller was awesome and delivered the exactly on time. The sony mobile box did not cover up with any plastic covers and it was completely opened. But there was a seal or sticker which has sticked on the box and it mentioned that do not open the box if the seal is broken. I am not sure whether this sticker was from Sony or the seller.The phone is awesome and I love sony very much. I had xperia S before and I upgraded now with this phone and I really satisfied with my purchase. Picture and Video quality is awesome and it is same like DSLR. I am finding some difficulties while listening others voice in the calls. But I am not sure that might be the default setting on the phone.

It does have few issues like thr Hotspot doesn't work cos it is connected to Verizon. Couldn't update to lollipop although Sony have released it months ago in all Z series and it doesn't connect with PC companion because of again it's Verizon connection. Overall I wished I have had what I ordered but still not bad.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: While the specs look good in paper/theory, the real life performance was disappointing.1. Camera: First let down was the camera. It is hard to believe the megapixel count on the camera. All the pics I took exhibited water color effect with lack of detail, over-saturation with HDR. The front camera took selfies which are grainy. Even the video quality was quite bad. (Check the camera reviews on C4 or M4, the Samsung S3 camera is better than this)2. Screen: 2nd let down is the screen, I may be spoiled by Samsung (previous phone was a s6 edge which I dropped and damaged) but the colors are very washed out, the brightness is not enough for use in sunlight here in Dallas Texas. I have liked LG G3, G4, Moto X pure screens not that I am completely partial to Samsung. But this screen is pure bad even BLU phones have better display. (Go to bestbuy and check out the C4 display you will know)3. Performance: With SD 810 processor and 3 gigs of ram, did not experience any abnormal heating issue (while using gps etc did get a little warm and the glass back made it hard to hold but not a problem if you have a case) or lags. The Sony UI is very clean and close to stock android.4. Software: Upgraded to Android 6.0 and there was no root available for it on xda.5. Battery Life: Battery life was good to OK, better than S6 edge but not as good as the S6 active. Little less than a Note 5 or Nexus 6pFeatures that are unique that made me buy this phone: Dual SIM, 3GB RAM. SD810, waterproof,NFC, 5.2 inch 1080p screen, 21 mpx camera.But the screen and camera alone was a bummer. With this phone there is no wow factor like when I got when I bough the S6 edge.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: The overall performance of the phone is great, also the camera.The only problem is the battery, it last for half a day not 2 days as it claims not even the whole day with average use.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: Bought 4. All of them came with supiciuos preinstalled glass protection. One of them for each family member (wife, me and sons). I came to the Z3+ in order to have all of my chargers standarized. My Z3 were a complete frustration about the magnetic conector (2 of them failed), but I still liked Sony for having a nice Android implementation. Also wanted to be conected with all my family during my stay in USA, so i decided for dual sim version. Two phones of the four I have bought have the touchscreen broken. I have realized of that as one of them stopped working properly after twoo weeks. In the past one dual sim Z3 supiciusly failed after trying to get photos of my daghter in the pool. Now, I have lose all confidence in dual sim versions selled on AMAZON with "no warranty". In the last twoo years 4 of the six phones I have bought failed (twoo Z3 and twoo Z3+). This has triggered the wish to move all family to iphones next year.Update: 3 of 4 Z3+ hace touchscreen broken!

Though I had to waste half an hour to set up as it came in with all defaults set and that too in some Chinese language. Therefore I had to find my way through language settings and then restored it. Doing that allowed me to get to all the initial settings as it should prompt for when you turn it on for the first time. Along with this the charger that came with it was European plug. The nice thing about this was it came pre-installed with screen protector. Plus it also had Sony ear-phones in the box. Also to all who are curious; Yes it does HEAT a lot and drains battery heavily. In order to take care of the heating issue, Sony has disabled 2 cores of CPU in the OTA update, hence making it very similar to SnapDragon 805 and 801. But the heating issue is still there after the update as well.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: TL;DR Buy this one only if you understand its shortcomings. Apart from general heating and unreliable focusing It's a great allrounder and makes all sense in the world to pick up last year's flagship for $300 from a reputed brand like Sony. You save nearly $400 if you are planning to buy todays flagship devices.I lost my phone in a car . The dishonest driver did not honor any of my requests to get my phone back . I was looking for a phone under $300 with good performance, screen and camera. I had to choose between NextBit Robin, Nexus 5x, OnePlus 2 and Moto G phones. Being a silent admirer for Sony products since childhood(Make no mistake, I have a Sony arsenal in my camera bag) I slipped into this deal on Amazon and immediately ordered one. I knew the shortcomings of this phone as it comes from the batch of products that were let down my Snapdragon 810 processor. I still took a chance for the price at which it was offered for.Initial impression during unboxingThe phone was solidThe phone looked beautiful and glossy. It had a preinstalled screen protectorThe copper color mitigated the smudges and dust .The box came with a travelling adaptor for US, a set of headphones with mic(I can't speak if it's an original one or a counter fake)A charging cable and no warranty papers.During Initial setupSince it was an international version, it came with Chinese language by default. It didn't take much time to set it back to English.The phone was getting very warm during the initial setup. All the phones including iPhones tend to get warmer during the setup.There were bunch of updates from Sony that was waiting to be installed and I updated them immediately.After the setup that took almost an hour, I restarted the phone. The phone felt less hot and snappierAfter few days of useThe phone that runs on Marshmallow, still tends to get warmer on the back even during normal browsing. Do no use without a case if you feel uncomfortable with its heating issue.The good part is that it gets cooler very fast.All the apps worked flawlesslyThere was only one instance of random reboot while watching a video on Facebook. (Facebook's new app has a history of being little mischievous with resources)The phone is surprisingly cool when on Youtube.The default email app and calendar app has been tuned to be more modern and usefulThe Sony lifelog app is stellar if you are into fitnessThe device as a music player which is decent. The sound quality is also good on headphones if not great.It also comes with FM radio, that is quite surprising during these days where flagships generally avoid themBattery performanceThe battery performance is not stellar. It can get you through a day very easilyThe charging time with the bundled adapter is slowPhone does not feel warm during chargingPerformancePerformance is good.You will never have issue with performance even after the CPU gets throttled after getting warmer3GB of RAM is adequate for a normal person day to day use.Snapdragon 810 does not disappoint in performance .Call quality, 4G , Wifi receptions has been good with no issues till now.DisplayDisplay is decent.It's easily visible under sunlightBeing an LCD screen. it does not wow you immediately. But you will start appreciating it over time for its subtle, natural, neutral color and temperatureTurn off the X-reality engine in Display settings to save some battery. I didn't find this much useful.CameraThis one is not as reliable as iPhone or Samsung camera.When it works properly, you get a great shot.You need to be patient to understand its shortcomings and learn to use it.It can produce great detailed photos.Sample Shot:[...]The manual mode is limited and may not please EnthusiastsVerdictKnow its shortcomings, understand the price at which its offered , you will not be dissapointedI use this phone withPThink® 2.5D Round Edge 0.3mm Ultra Slim Nano Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) (Not for Z3) with 9H Hardness/Anti-scratch/Fingerprint resistant (Sony Xperia Z3+)Xperia Z3+ Case - Ringke FUSION ***All New Dust Cap & Drop Protection*** [Free Screen Protector&Back Film][SMOKE BLACK] Premium Crystal Clear Back Shock Absorption Bumper Hard Case for Sony Xperia Z3+ / Z3 Plus (Not for Z3 / Z3 Compact / Z3 Dual / Z3v / Z3 Tablet) - Eco/DIY Package

I have an Iphone 6 too and it gets hot and over heats as well with GPS and hotspot enabled, this can be normal function with prolonged use.Battery life is very good, I surf a lot during work day and after 5 hours of use I had 70% battery. My rating for over all is 9/10 due to all the features:Premium CameraWater resistance IPX 68MicroSD up to 128gb32gb internal ( about 22gb with 6.01)5.2 inch screen Full HDGood battery life3gb ramaround 300 USD ( 9/2016 price) new unlockednice premium build quality4g LTE (Yes LTE does show up, I'm on Cricket)some Sony bloatware can be deleted offMost of the previous reviews talking about heating up and the phone getting hot are referring to before the updates and phones on 5.016.01 fixes all of this

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: I love the new Sony Z3+. I've been an iPhone user since 2007 when the first one came out. So, I was skeptical switching to Androids OS. Sony has done a great job of keeping things relatively simply UI wise. From comparing it with my friends Nexus which runs Stock Android, Sony hasn't strayed far away from Stock Android. Functionally, it does everything mostly the same as a stock system with a few added touches, that are well integrated. It does come with some bloatware but its non-invasive to the user experience, other than taking up some internal memory, which is easily compensated for with a good size micro SD card. I can do everything, multi-tasking is easy, it runs smoothly. The User Interface is very clean looking. Its aesthetically pleasing, well organized and doesn't look cluttered with a bunch of things. The clean looking interface is something i noticed was very different from Samsung's touchwiz, something I noticed when I had a chance to play around with a friends Galaxy S5 and was deciding on a new smartphone to purchase . Touchwiz on the S5 was quite cluttered and the theme wasn't as aesthetically pleasing to me. It was more of an eyesore despite the fact that I love OLED technology and Samsung is the only one using the display tech, the theme/skin just isn't nice too look at. Sony still has a much better grasp on design and aesthetics than its Korean revival. Another plus, great images underwater. The camera is absolutely fantastic. For most the camera could be hard to use because its Auto mode may not be the best, though not bad, it could be better. In Manual Mode this camera outshines the iPhone for sure. I can't speak on other phone cameras but i trust Sony to put the best sensor in their Phone. After all, they make almost all the sensors for iPhone and other smartphone companies. And Sony makes fantastics cameras, DSLRs and snap and shoots. They are also, creating image sensors for medical use and their cameras are the most used in the Professional Filming industry. All that technology is packed into this small little smartphone camera and it works wonderfully (other than the heating issue associated with Qualcomm's snapdragon 810 chipset)In regards to the over heating issue. It isn't as bad as some make it seem. it really only shows problems when using the AR modes and 4k on the camera app. Which is unfortunate because 4k is great and the AR modes are quite fun to use. Overall though, it heats up just like any other phone does when it comes to multitasking, long phone calls, or running heavy apps such as games with intensive graphics and waze. But it isn't bothersome. I remember all these things would cause my iPhone to get pretty hot. So, its not really an issue. I guess it does get a bit hotter than some other phones but I can't really blame Sony. At least they owned up to the fact that it does get hot and are trying to address the issue. Qualcomm the maker of the chipset won't even own up to the problem which is affecting Sony, HTC, LG and couple other flagship models. Shame on Qualcomm for ignoring their customers. If overheating is deterring you from buying this phone, be aware that the Samsung S6 is also suffering from heating issues. Just look up "Samsung S6 heating up" in google. The issue gets overlooked because Samsung is selling so many phones that google doesn't show the bad stuff first, Just like yelp doesn't show you the recent bad reviews of a restaurant unless refine the search to do so. HTC M9 is also heating up. This problem isn't only associated with Sony.Other than the heating issues when using the Camera Apps 4k mode and AR mode, everything else works great and I love it. Give Sony a shot if you are looking to try Android or want to buy a new Android that isn't the usual HTC, Samsung or LG.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: So I purchased this one from Perfect Trading Inc, and it arrived in a seal pack condition. Though I had to waste half an hour to set up as it came in with all defaults set and that too in some Chinese language. Therefore I had to find my way through language settings and then restored it. Doing that allowed me to get to all the initial settings as it should prompt for when you turn it on for the first time. Along with this the charger that came with it was European plug. The nice thing about this was it came pre-installed with screen protector. Plus it also had Sony ear-phones in the box. Also to all who are curious; Yes it does HEAT a lot and drains battery heavily. In order to take care of the heating issue, Sony has disabled 2 cores of CPU in the OTA update, hence making it very similar to SnapDragon 805 and 801. But the heating issue is still there after the update as well.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: While the specs look good in paper/theory, the real life performance was disappointing.1. Camera: First let down was the camera. It is hard to believe the megapixel count on the camera. All the pics I took exhibited water color effect with lack of detail, over-saturation with HDR. The front camera took selfies which are grainy. Even the video quality was quite bad. (Check the camera reviews on C4 or M4, the Samsung S3 camera is better than this)2. Screen: 2nd let down is the screen, I may be spoiled by Samsung (previous phone was a s6 edge which I dropped and damaged) but the colors are very washed out, the brightness is not enough for use in sunlight here in Dallas Texas. I have liked LG G3, G4, Moto X pure screens not that I am completely partial to Samsung. But this screen is pure bad even BLU phones have better display. (Go to bestbuy and check out the C4 display you will know)3. Performance: With SD 810 processor and 3 gigs of ram, did not experience any abnormal heating issue (while using gps etc did get a little warm and the glass back made it hard to hold but not a problem if you have a case) or lags. The Sony UI is very clean and close to stock android.4. Software: Upgraded to Android 6.0 and there was no root available for it on xda.5. Battery Life: Battery life was good to OK, better than S6 edge but not as good as the S6 active. Little less than a Note 5 or Nexus 6pFeatures that are unique that made me buy this phone: Dual SIM, 3GB RAM. SD810, waterproof,NFC, 5.2 inch 1080p screen, 21 mpx camera.But the screen and camera alone was a bummer. With this phone there is no wow factor like when I got when I bough the S6 edge.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB Black Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: Bought 4. All of them came with supiciuos preinstalled glass protection. One of them for each family member (wife, me and sons). I came to the Z3+ in order to have all of my chargers standarized. My Z3 were a complete frustration about the magnetic conector (2 of them failed), but I still liked Sony for having a nice Android implementation. Also wanted to be conected with all my family during my stay in USA, so i decided for dual sim version. Two phones of the four I have bought have the touchscreen broken. I have realized of that as one of them stopped working properly after twoo weeks. In the past one dual sim Z3 supiciusly failed after trying to get photos of my daghter in the pool. Now, I have lose all confidence in dual sim versions selled on AMAZON with "no warranty". In the last twoo years 4 of the six phones I have bought failed (twoo Z3 and twoo Z3+). This has triggered the wish to move all family to iphones next year.Update: 3 of 4 Z3+ hace touchscreen broken!

Doing that allowed me to get to all the initial settings as it should prompt for when you turn it on for the first time. Along with this the charger that came with it was European plug. The nice thing about this was it came pre-installed with screen protector. Plus it also had Sony ear-phones in the box. Also to all who are curious; Yes it does HEAT a lot and drains battery heavily. In order to take care of the heating issue, Sony has disabled 2 cores of CPU in the OTA update, hence making it very similar to SnapDragon 805 and 801. But the heating issue is still there after the update as well.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: I love the new Sony Z3+. I've been an iPhone user since 2007 when the first one came out. So, I was skeptical switching to Androids OS. Sony has done a great job of keeping things relatively simply UI wise. From comparing it with my friends Nexus which runs Stock Android, Sony hasn't strayed far away from Stock Android. Functionally, it does everything mostly the same as a stock system with a few added touches, that are well integrated. It does come with some bloatware but its non-invasive to the user experience, other than taking up some internal memory, which is easily compensated for with a good size micro SD card. I can do everything, multi-tasking is easy, it runs smoothly. The User Interface is very clean looking. Its aesthetically pleasing, well organized and doesn't look cluttered with a bunch of things. The clean looking interface is something i noticed was very different from Samsung's touchwiz, something I noticed when I had a chance to play around with a friends Galaxy S5 and was deciding on a new smartphone to purchase . Touchwiz on the S5 was quite cluttered and the theme wasn't as aesthetically pleasing to me. It was more of an eyesore despite the fact that I love OLED technology and Samsung is the only one using the display tech, the theme/skin just isn't nice too look at. Sony still has a much better grasp on design and aesthetics than its Korean revival. Another plus, great images underwater. The camera is absolutely fantastic. For most the camera could be hard to use because its Auto mode may not be the best, though not bad, it could be better. In Manual Mode this camera outshines the iPhone for sure. I can't speak on other phone cameras but i trust Sony to put the best sensor in their Phone. After all, they make almost all the sensors for iPhone and other smartphone companies. And Sony makes fantastics cameras, DSLRs and snap and shoots. They are also, creating image sensors for medical use and their cameras are the most used in the Professional Filming industry. All that technology is packed into this small little smartphone camera and it works wonderfully (other than the heating issue associated with Qualcomm's snapdragon 810 chipset)In regards to the over heating issue. It isn't as bad as some make it seem. it really only shows problems when using the AR modes and 4k on the camera app. Which is unfortunate because 4k is great and the AR modes are quite fun to use. Overall though, it heats up just like any other phone does when it comes to multitasking, long phone calls, or running heavy apps such as games with intensive graphics and waze. But it isn't bothersome. I remember all these things would cause my iPhone to get pretty hot. So, its not really an issue. I guess it does get a bit hotter than some other phones but I can't really blame Sony. At least they owned up to the fact that it does get hot and are trying to address the issue. Qualcomm the maker of the chipset won't even own up to the problem which is affecting Sony, HTC, LG and couple other flagship models. Shame on Qualcomm for ignoring their customers. If overheating is deterring you from buying this phone, be aware that the Samsung S6 is also suffering from heating issues. Just look up "Samsung S6 heating up" in google. The issue gets overlooked because Samsung is selling so many phones that google doesn't show the bad stuff first, Just like yelp doesn't show you the recent bad reviews of a restaurant unless refine the search to do so. HTC M9 is also heating up. This problem isn't only associated with Sony.Other than the heating issues when using the Camera Apps 4k mode and AR mode, everything else works great and I love it. Give Sony a shot if you are looking to try Android or want to buy a new Android that isn't the usual HTC, Samsung or LG.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty

It overheats so much that camera is not stable and will turn off after 1-2 mins of video recording, same for other serious products. To keep device in your hand is not comfortable because it is becoming hot everytime you load any middle application.Design is perfect but the phone is just for calling, it speed components can't be used because of overheat. Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: While the specs look good in paper/theory, the real life performance was disappointing.1. Camera: First let down was the camera. It is hard to believe the megapixel count on the camera. All the pics I took exhibited water color effect with lack of detail, over-saturation with HDR. The front camera took selfies which are grainy. Even the video quality was quite bad. (Check the camera reviews on C4 or M4, the Samsung S3 camera is better than this)2. Screen: 2nd let down is the screen, I may be spoiled by Samsung (previous phone was a s6 edge which I dropped and damaged) but the colors are very washed out, the brightness is not enough for use in sunlight here in Dallas Texas. I have liked LG G3, G4, Moto X pure screens not that I am completely partial to Samsung. But this screen is pure bad even BLU phones have better display. (Go to bestbuy and check out the C4 display you will know)3. Performance: With SD 810 processor and 3 gigs of ram, did not experience any abnormal heating issue (while using gps etc did get a little warm and the glass back made it hard to hold but not a problem if you have a case) or lags. The Sony UI is very clean and close to stock android.4. Software: Upgraded to Android 6.0 and there was no root available for it on xda.5. Battery Life: Battery life was good to OK, better than S6 edge but not as good as the S6 active. Little less than a Note 5 or Nexus 6pFeatures that are unique that made me buy this phone: Dual SIM, 3GB RAM. SD810, waterproof,NFC, 5.2 inch 1080p screen, 21 mpx camera.But the screen and camera alone was a bummer. With this phone there is no wow factor like when I got when I bough the S6 edge.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty

Reviews: Bought 4. All of them came with supiciuos preinstalled glass protection. One of them for each family member (wife, me and sons). My Z3 were a complete frustration about the magnetic conector (2 of them failed), but I still liked Sony for having a nice Android implementation. Also wanted to be conected with all my family during my stay in USA, so i decided for dual sim version. Two phones of the four I have bought have the touchscreen broken. I have realized of that as one of them stopped working properly after twoo weeks. In the past one dual sim Z3 supiciusly failed after trying to get photos of my daghter in the pool. Now, I have lose all confidence in dual sim versions selled on AMAZON with "no warranty". In the last twoo years 4 of the six phones I have bought failed (twoo Z3 and twoo Z3+). This has triggered the wish to move all family to iphones next year.Update: 3 of 4 Z3+ hace touchscreen broken!

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: TL;DR Buy this one only if you understand its shortcomings. Apart from general heating and unreliable focusing It's a great allrounder and makes all sense in the world to pick up last year's flagship for $300 from a reputed brand like Sony. You save nearly $400 if you are planning to buy todays flagship devices.I lost my phone in a car . The dishonest driver did not honor any of my requests to get my phone back . I was looking for a phone under $300 with good performance, screen and camera. I had to choose between NextBit Robin, Nexus 5x, OnePlus 2 and Moto G phones. Being a silent admirer for Sony products since childhood(Make no mistake, I have a Sony arsenal in my camera bag) I slipped into this deal on Amazon and immediately ordered one. I knew the shortcomings of this phone as it comes from the batch of products that were let down my Snapdragon 810 processor. I still took a chance for the price at which it was offered for.Initial impression during unboxingThe phone was solidThe phone looked beautiful and glossy. It had a preinstalled screen protectorThe copper color mitigated the smudges and dust .The box came with a travelling adaptor for US, a set of headphones with mic(I can't speak if it's an original one or a counter fake)A charging cable and no warranty papers.During Initial setupSince it was an international version, it came with Chinese language by default. It didn't take much time to set it back to English.The phone was getting very warm during the initial setup. All the phones including iPhones tend to get warmer during the setup.There were bunch of updates from Sony that was waiting to be installed and I updated them immediately.After the setup that took almost an hour, I restarted the phone. The phone felt less hot and snappierAfter few days of useThe phone that runs on Marshmallow, still tends to get warmer on the back even during normal browsing. Do no use without a case if you feel uncomfortable with its heating issue.The good part is that it gets cooler very fast.All the apps worked flawlesslyThere was only one instance of random reboot while watching a video on Facebook. (Facebook's new app has a history of being little mischievous with resources)The phone is surprisingly cool when on Youtube.The default email app and calendar app has been tuned to be more modern and usefulThe Sony lifelog app is stellar if you are into fitnessThe device as a music player which is decent. The sound quality is also good on headphones if not great.It also comes with FM radio, that is quite surprising during these days where flagships generally avoid themBattery performanceThe battery performance is not stellar. It can get you through a day very easilyThe charging time with the bundled adapter is slowPhone does not feel warm during chargingPerformancePerformance is good.You will never have issue with performance even after the CPU gets throttled after getting warmer3GB of RAM is adequate for a normal person day to day use.Snapdragon 810 does not disappoint in performance .Call quality, 4G , Wifi receptions has been good with no issues till now.DisplayDisplay is decent.It's easily visible under sunlightBeing an LCD screen. it does not wow you immediately. But you will start appreciating it over time for its subtle, natural, neutral color and temperatureTurn off the X-reality engine in Display settings to save some battery. I didn't find this much useful.CameraThis one is not as reliable as iPhone or Samsung camera.When it works properly, you get a great shot.You need to be patient to understand its shortcomings and learn to use it.It can produce great detailed photos.Sample Shot:[...]The manual mode is limited and may not please EnthusiastsVerdictKnow its shortcomings, understand the price at which its offered , you will not be dissapointedI use this phone withPThink® 2.5D Round Edge 0.3mm Ultra Slim Nano Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) (Not for Z3) with 9H Hardness/Anti-scratch/Fingerprint resistant (Sony Xperia Z3+)Xperia Z3+ Case - Ringke FUSION ***All New Dust Cap & Drop Protection*** [Free Screen Protector&Back Film][SMOKE BLACK] Premium Crystal Clear Back Shock Absorption Bumper Hard Case for Sony Xperia Z3+ / Z3 Plus (Not for Z3 / Z3 Compact / Z3 Dual / Z3v / Z3 Tablet) - Eco/DIY Package

Reviews: Does not overheat with new Marsh-Mellow 6.01 search youtube there is a live test that in 4k video test it used to overheat at 10-12 minutes and now lasts over 30 minutes of recording, this can be normal, other phones overheat too after 30 plus minutes of continued recording 4k. I have an Iphone 6 too and it gets hot and over heats as well with GPS and hotspot enabled, this can be normal function with prolonged use.Battery life is very good, I surf a lot during work day and after 5 hours of use I had 70% battery. My rating for over all is 9/10 due to all the features:Premium CameraWater resistance IPX 68MicroSD up to 128gb32gb internal ( about 22gb with 6.01)5.2 inch screen Full HDGood battery life3gb ramaround 300 USD ( 9/2016 price) new unlockednice premium build quality4g LTE (Yes LTE does show up, I'm on Cricket)some Sony bloatware can be deleted offMost of the previous reviews talking about heating up and the phone getting hot are referring to before the updates and phones on 5.016.01 fixes all of this

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: got scared a little when it came all in chinese language, had to look at another android device to refresh my memory where do you change language :) And then mobile data wasnt working right away, but looks like you just need to "download internet and mms settings" form "settings - wireless and networks - ...more". And after that T-mobile date works at full speed, with LTE and everything.I saw comments that the phone is heating alot, that is not really true, i had Z1 and Z3 before, it is not getting any hotter than the previous ones. Of course if you leave it in the sun, in a summer day in Las Vegas, it will get hot, but since it is waterproof in that case i just put it under running water, or go swimming with it at a pool to cool it down :) very convenient and effective.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Plus E6533 32GB White Dual Sim Unlocked International GSM model - No Warranty
Reviews: So I purchased this one from Perfect Trading Inc, and it arrived in a seal pack condition. Though I had to waste half an hour to set up as it came in with all defaults set and that too in some Chinese language. Therefore I had to find my way through language settings and then restored it. Doing that allowed me to get to all the initial settings as it should prompt for when you turn it on for the first time. Along with this the charger that came with it was European plug. The nice thing about this was it came pre-installed with screen protector. Plus it also had Sony ear-phones in the box. Also to all who are curious; Yes it does HEAT a lot and drains battery heavily. In order to take care of the heating issue, Sony has disabled 2 cores of CPU in the OTA update, hence making it very similar to SnapDragon 805 and 801. But the heating issue is still there after the update as well.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6533 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone Dual Sim - International Stock No warranty (Copper)
Reviews: I bought it without checking different forums, as my wife owns Z1 which is perfect device.As soon as I turned on the phone it started to heat. I was suprized, as it was absoutely uncomfortable for top level of device. After few research I discovered that overheat - is a critical issue for sony Z3+. It overheats so much that camera is not stable and will turn off after 1-2 mins of video recording, same for other serious products. To keep device in your hand is not comfortable because it is becoming hot everytime you load any middle application.Design is perfect but the phone is just for calling, it speed components can't be used because of overheat. No Sony phones in the future.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6533 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone Dual Sim - International Stock No warranty (Copper)
Reviews: While the specs look good in paper/theory, the real life performance was disappointing.1. Camera: First let down was the camera. It is hard to believe the megapixel count on the camera. All the pics I took exhibited water color effect with lack of detail, over-saturation with HDR. The front camera took selfies which are grainy. Even the video quality was quite bad. (Check the camera reviews on C4 or M4, the Samsung S3 camera is better than this)2. Screen: 2nd let down is the screen, I may be spoiled by Samsung (previous phone was a s6 edge which I dropped and damaged) but the colors are very washed out, the brightness is not enough for use in sunlight here in Dallas Texas. I have liked LG G3, G4, Moto X pure screens not that I am completely partial to Samsung. But this screen is pure bad even BLU phones have better display. (Go to bestbuy and check out the C4 display you will know)3. Performance: With SD 810 processor and 3 gigs of ram, did not experience any abnormal heating issue (while using gps etc did get a little warm and the glass back made it hard to hold but not a problem if you have a case) or lags. The Sony UI is very clean and close to stock android.4. Software: Upgraded to Android 6.0 and there was no root available for it on xda.5. Battery Life: Battery life was good to OK, better than S6 edge but not as good as the S6 active. Little less than a Note 5 or Nexus 6pFeatures that are unique that made me buy this phone: Dual SIM, 3GB RAM. SD810, waterproof,NFC, 5.2 inch 1080p screen, 21 mpx camera.But the screen and camera alone was a bummer. With this phone there is no wow factor like when I got when I bough the S6 edge.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6533 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone Dual Sim - International Stock No warranty (Copper)

Reviews: Bought 4. All of them came with supiciuos preinstalled glass protection. One of them for each family member (wife, me and sons). I came to the Z3+ in order to have all of my chargers standarized. My Z3 were a complete frustration about the magnetic conector (2 of them failed), but I still liked Sony for having a nice Android implementation. Also wanted to be conected with all my family during my stay in USA, so i decided for dual sim version. Two phones of the four I have bought have the touchscreen broken. I have realized of that as one of them stopped working properly after twoo weeks. In the past one dual sim Z3 supiciusly failed after trying to get photos of my daghter in the pool. Now, I have lose all confidence in dual sim versions selled on AMAZON with "no warranty". In the last twoo years 4 of the six phones I have bought failed (twoo Z3 and twoo Z3+). This has triggered the wish to move all family to iphones next year.Update: 3 of 4 Z3+ hace touchscreen broken!

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6533 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone Dual Sim - International Stock No warranty (Copper)
Reviews: TL;DR Buy this one only if you understand its shortcomings. Apart from general heating and unreliable focusing It's a great allrounder and makes all sense in the world to pick up last year's flagship for $300 from a reputed brand like Sony. You save nearly $400 if you are planning to buy todays flagship devices.I lost my phone in a car . The dishonest driver did not honor any of my requests to get my phone back . I was looking for a phone under $300 with good performance, screen and camera. I had to choose between NextBit Robin, Nexus 5x, OnePlus 2 and Moto G phones. Being a silent admirer for Sony products since childhood(Make no mistake, I have a Sony arsenal in my camera bag) I slipped into this deal on Amazon and immediately ordered one. I knew the shortcomings of this phone as it comes from the batch of products that were let down my Snapdragon 810 processor. I still took a chance for the price at which it was offered for.Initial impression during unboxingThe phone was solidThe phone looked beautiful and glossy. It had a preinstalled screen protectorThe copper color mitigated the smudges and dust .The box came with a travelling adaptor for US, a set of headphones with mic(I can't speak if it's an original one or a counter fake)A charging cable and no warranty papers.During Initial setupSince it was an international version, it came with Chinese language by default. It didn't take much time to set it back to English.The phone was getting very warm during the initial setup. All the phones including iPhones tend to get warmer during the setup.There were bunch of updates from Sony that was waiting to be installed and I updated them immediately.After the setup that took almost an hour, I restarted the phone. The phone felt less hot and snappierAfter few days of useThe phone that runs on Marshmallow, still tends to get warmer on the back even during normal browsing. Do no use without a case if you feel uncomfortable with its heating issue.The good part is that it gets cooler very fast.All the apps worked flawlesslyThere was only one instance of random reboot while watching a video on Facebook. (Facebook's new app has a history of being little mischievous with resources)The phone is surprisingly cool when on Youtube.The default email app and calendar app has been tuned to be more modern and usefulThe Sony lifelog app is stellar if you are into fitnessThe device as a music player which is decent. The sound quality is also good on headphones if not great.It also comes with FM radio, that is quite surprising during these days where flagships generally avoid themBattery performanceThe battery performance is not stellar. It can get you through a day very easilyThe charging time with the bundled adapter is slowPhone does not feel warm during chargingPerformancePerformance is good.You will never have issue with performance even after the CPU gets throttled after getting warmer3GB of RAM is adequate for a normal person day to day use.Snapdragon 810 does not disappoint in performance .Call quality, 4G , Wifi receptions has been good with no issues till now.DisplayDisplay is decent.It's easily visible under sunlightBeing an LCD screen. it does not wow you immediately. But you will start appreciating it over time for its subtle, natural, neutral color and temperatureTurn off the X-reality engine in Display settings to save some battery. I didn't find this much useful.CameraThis one is not as reliable as iPhone or Samsung camera.When it works properly, you get a great shot.You need to be patient to understand its shortcomings and learn to use it.It can produce great detailed photos.Sample Shot:[...]The manual mode is limited and may not please EnthusiastsVerdictKnow its shortcomings, understand the price at which its offered , you will not be dissapointedI use this phone withPThink® 2.5D Round Edge 0.3mm Ultra Slim Nano Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) (Not for Z3) with 9H Hardness/Anti-scratch/Fingerprint resistant (Sony Xperia Z3+)Xperia Z3+ Case - Ringke FUSION ***All New Dust Cap & Drop Protection*** [Free Screen Protector&Back Film][SMOKE BLACK] Premium Crystal Clear Back Shock Absorption Bumper Hard Case for Sony Xperia Z3+ / Z3 Plus (Not for Z3 / Z3 Compact / Z3 Dual / Z3v / Z3 Tablet) - Eco/DIY Package

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6533 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone Dual Sim - International Stock No warranty (Copper)
Reviews: I love the new Sony Z3+. I've been an iPhone user since 2007 when the first one came out. So, I was skeptical switching to Androids OS. Sony has done a great job of keeping things relatively simply UI wise. From comparing it with my friends Nexus which runs Stock Android, Sony hasn't strayed far away from Stock Android. Functionally, it does everything mostly the same as a stock system with a few added touches, that are well integrated. It does come with some bloatware but its non-invasive to the user experience, other than taking up some internal memory, which is easily compensated for with a good size micro SD card. I can do everything, multi-tasking is easy, it runs smoothly. The User Interface is very clean looking. Its aesthetically pleasing, well organized and doesn't look cluttered with a bunch of things. The clean looking interface is something i noticed was very different from Samsung's touchwiz, something I noticed when I had a chance to play around with a friends Galaxy S5 and was deciding on a new smartphone to purchase . Touchwiz on the S5 was quite cluttered and the theme wasn't as aesthetically pleasing to me. It was more of an eyesore despite the fact that I love OLED technology and Samsung is the only one using the display tech, the theme/skin just isn't nice too look at. Sony still has a much better grasp on design and aesthetics than its Korean revival. Another plus, great images underwater. The camera is absolutely fantastic. For most the camera could be hard to use because its Auto mode may not be the best, though not bad, it could be better. In Manual Mode this camera outshines the iPhone for sure. I can't speak on other phone cameras but i trust Sony to put the best sensor in their Phone. After all, they make almost all the sensors for iPhone and other smartphone companies. And Sony makes fantastics cameras, DSLRs and snap and shoots. They are also, creating image sensors for medical use and their cameras are the most used in the Professional Filming industry. All that technology is packed into this small little smartphone camera and it works wonderfully (other than the heating issue associated with Qualcomm's snapdragon 810 chipset)In regards to the over heating issue. It isn't as bad as some make it seem. it really only shows problems when using the AR modes and 4k on the camera app. Which is unfortunate because 4k is great and the AR modes are quite fun to use. Overall though, it heats up just like any other phone does when it comes to multitasking, long phone calls, or running heavy apps such as games with intensive graphics and waze. But it isn't bothersome. I remember all these things would cause my iPhone to get pretty hot. So, its not really an issue. I guess it does get a bit hotter than some other phones but I can't really blame Sony. At least they owned up to the fact that it does get hot and are trying to address the issue. Qualcomm the maker of the chipset won't even own up to the problem which is affecting Sony, HTC, LG and couple other flagship models. Shame on Qualcomm for ignoring their customers. If overheating is deterring you from buying this phone, be aware that the Samsung S6 is also suffering from heating issues. Just look up "Samsung S6 heating up" in google. The issue gets overlooked because Samsung is selling so many phones that google doesn't show the bad stuff first, Just like yelp doesn't show you the recent bad reviews of a restaurant unless refine the search to do so. HTC M9 is also heating up. This problem isn't only associated with Sony.Other than the heating issues when using the Camera Apps 4k mode and AR mode, everything else works great and I love it. Give Sony a shot if you are looking to try Android or want to buy a new Android that isn't the usual HTC, Samsung or LG.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: So I had done a lot of research before the purchase of this phone and it is absolutely fantastic. Please not that after you sign in and get set up it will require updated that will take at least 30-45min as the phone updated to Marshmallow from Lollipop.> Excellent build> Great Battery life> Performance is amazing> Screen is beautiful and clean, the built in email app is fantastic,> if you have an Outlook, Hotmail or Live email and use MS for everything, this app is better than the Outlook app and it syncs to the phone Calendar and contacts> I have a 128G card in the phone and its easy to move apps to the card> overall could not be happierOnly issue I have is HFP for the Google maps and Texting through my cars Audio system. Not sure if its the BT profile or the OS that is the issue, research has shown at this moment its the OS and how Google handles HFP.Update: 4-6-2016 down graded to 1 star, Woke up this morning to the phone beeping, would not turn on so I shut it down holding the power button. Restarted and thought all was good. As I started to work on the phone it got really hot and I received a message that the UI was not longer workingI restarted several times but no luck. I have returned the phone, Amazon is great on stuff like this. I have chosen to go with the Moto X Pure Edition as it has the Snapdragon 808 vs the 810 that seems to have issues. I truly loved the size and feel of the Sony and was hoping the issues were do to bad users, unfortunately the units are probably just bad. (I did update to the latest firmware and Marshmallow software using the Sony desktop application as recommended)

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: This phone just blows your other phones out of the water. It quite literally is the best phone out there. If you buy itbrand new, international, Amazon is kind enough to include an adapter for the phone for wherever they are shipping the device to. The phone, brand new takesa few updates that'll take take around 3 hours to finish, but once you're done, it's Marshmallow(latest Android update) heaven baby. The phone, despite being a last generation Xperia Device can take anything you throw at it. Any app, any game, it'll heat up to a point, but not enough to shut it down or damage the device. Heat is only natural for these devices as there are no other ways to disperse the heat besides the built in heat sinks. And the heat is not a bad thing, that just means your phone is doing work.I give this phone a 5/5 for now let's wait for the upcoming weeks.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: Pros:- Great out-of-box experience with the Android operating system. It's not heavily bogged with unwanted software. There is some software that comes from Sony that is uninstallable but most of it could be disabled. My previous phone was a LG Nexus 4 and compared to what came installed on that, I think it's pretty good.- Beautifully designed phone. The phone is slim, flat with rounded corners and glass backing. Nothing fancy but that's what makes it nice.- It's a powerful phone in terms of speed. It has a Qualcomm Snapdragon 810 processor that makes everything run smoothly. This is also a problem related to heat, more on that later.- Although the phone is advertised as waterproof, that's not true. It's more water-resistant actually. It's good for splashes and being caught in the rain but don't risk diving into a pool or ocean with it. An article from Xperia Blog explains why, I'd link it but Amazon won't let me for some reason.- "my Xperia" security feature. This feature makes it so a thief can't simply factory restore your stolen smartphone and use it. Only the Google account that factory reset it may unlock it. This is also a problem because of how it works, details under Cons.Cons:- Storage space usage of the Android OS. It has 32 GB of space for internal storage but about 9 GB is allotted for the Android OS (as of Android Marshmallow.- The heat this phone produces because of the Snapdragon 810. If you use this phone to do intensive or moderately intensive things (gaming, recording video, taking pictures, streaming...) the phone will warn you that it's becoming too hot and eventually shut itself off. This is problematic for times when you need your phone to work like capturing important moments of your life through the camera. I've had my Z3+ shut itself off when I was using it to record notes during a college class, that sucked.- The phone advertises that it has great battery life (2 days) and one of its selling points is STAMINA Mode. STAMINA Mode conserves battery life by allowing only specific apps to function while it's off and does other things too. The Z3+ had STAMINA mode when it was running Android Lollipop but when it upgraded to Android Marshmallow, that feature was removed. I loved the battery life when it was running Lollipop but not Marshmallow.- "my Xperia" security feature can lock you out of your Google account and phone if you use two factor authentication. The security feature requires you to log into your Google account using a password, not the code for two factor authentication. My authenticator codes are generated on the phone through the Google Authenticator app. When I activated the security feature, it locked the phone down and I no longer had access to the authenticator app, so I was locked out of my phone and my Google account. I was saved by backup codes I had printed out to go into my Google account deactivate two factor authentication.Bottom line: This is a nice phone but the issue with the heat, I can't recommend it for anyone that relies on their smartphone to do things other than calling, texting and browsing the internet, which is probably lots of people.Update: June 5, 2016STAMINA Mode has returned in an update I received the next day after I posted the review. Looking at how it's implemented in Marshmallow versus Lollipop, it provides the functions of conserving battery life but it removes any options for specifying which apps that it affects. That means all apps have limited functionality and that's bad if you want a specific app to have high priority. This is an issue when you want apps like email, messaging apps or app syncing to give you updates/notifications/functions ASAP. I can enable STAMINA Mode on at all times but it leaves a permanent notification that it's enabled, which is annoying. I didn't have this annoying notification in Lollipop.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: Gorgeous phone. Aesthetically ranks 10/10. Amazing look and feel to it. But.....andt this is a major deal breaking but!This phone runs extremely hot. I mean hot enough to cook your dinner on. It's really a shame as I was trying to convince myself to keep it despite this major flaw. But the reality is if the form doesn't follow function then it is useless as far as I am concerned.I really hope Sony tries to make another iteration of this phone without the Snapdragon 810 processor. The phone is too thin to dissipate the heat generated by this monster processor, and the design of the phone prohibits the effective use of this chip. Apparently a software patch will be out soon, but this will only serve to slow down the processor. At the end of the day, this is a hardware issue.I don't know what else quite frankly I'll be purchasing as I don't think anything comes close to it in terms of aesthetic appeal.On another note, the phone was shipped in an unsealed box. I am not used to purchasing new phones in an open box, and it would be nice if the vendor stated this before shipping it.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: I should have stayed with the Z3. Highly recommend staying away. Unrooted version. The phone is clean.Pros:fast processor, decent screen, decent soundConsBattery life sucks. Overheats to ridiculous levels. Not fully compatible with Sony Bluetooth headphones.I will focus on what is wrong since those features are what matter to me the most.Battery life is BAD. Using the standard Sony Launcher, with 1-2 hours of calls each day, 50-100 texts, one or two youtube videos of 5 mins each, the battery barely lasts 7-8 hours. I don't play games other than occasional crossword. General activities are check email, update todo, and do calendars. My workday goes from 6 AM to 10 PM. So at 3/4 of my day, the phone is dead. It takes 4 hours for a full recharge. I have to charge in 10 minute bursts to keep up for the rest of the day.Heating is a HUGE problem. If the calls go longer than 10-15 minutes, the phone can barely be handled. Yes, it has the latest firmware in it. I cannot place the phone against my ear or even hold it by the corners because of the heating. That brings us to the next problem. I tried using headsets.The bluetooth pairing with Bose earpiece is bad on a good day. It drops the bluetooth connections randomly. The earpiece is in perfect shape since it works correctly with every other phone in the house (iphone, galaxy, moto X and moto G). So I purchased a Sony set. Same problems.Then I find out that it does not support wireless charging which Z3 supports. Obviously I did not do enough homework.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: Replaced my S6 edge that had overheating and speed issues/no issues on this phone with over heating or slowing like my s6 other pros and cons below (Spoiler Alert: not many cons)Pros:Great Screen (Once pre-applied screen protector is removed)Fully waterproof ip68 (Trust me it is, took some underwater video in a pool)Camera is sharp and fast video looks great and color reproduction is spot on (After update)Front facing stereo speakers are loud and clear (but nexus 6 is louder and clearer)Super thin and light, but doesn't feel fragileNO CAMERA BUMP!!!!!Copper color is absolutely beautiful especially compared to samsung and apple's tacky gold (Copper is really closer to Rose Gold)Front camera is wide angle and has excellent image quality ( Yay for selfies)Battery, Unlike the S6 i actually get through a full day of normal usage (After Software Update)MICRO SD!!! Put in a 64gb card and have over 90GB to store stuff!!Lanyard loop, its great for hiking or taking photos and video underwater (Doesn't Come with lanyard though)CAMERA SHUTTER BUTTON!!!!!!! just like a real camera , press it to launch the camera even when the phone is off, half way focus full press shutter... every phone should have this (also is a requirement for underwater photography as no touch screen works underwater)Near stock android (avoids software related issues and makes things run smoooooth, (rumor is that the next update will bring an even closer to stock android experience)Cons:MAKE SURE YOU UPDATE ALL THE SOFTWARE! (otherwise you will have overheating issues and camera quality wont be as good)REMOVE SCREEN PROTECTOR THAT COMES PRE-APPLIED (it smudges more easily than the glass, it is very reflective, and it ruins the screen quality) (i was very disappointed with the display until i peeled it off)No fingerprint sensorNo OIS in the camera (but also no camera bump!)No USB Type C (although only one phone has this and you cant even buy it)This to me is the only true con, no QI wireless charging

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: I haven't had this phone for a full day and I am in love with it. I've had them all. Blackberry, Windows, IPhone and Note 3, 4 and 5. I actually really like WP, but the app gap is an issue for me. The IPhone is the most overrated phone I have ever used. In my opinion, there is no beating an android. I have been extremely happy with the Note series. Now my Note literally looks like a hunk of junk compared to this. This is the nicest looking phone I've ever seen and I am extremely happy I chose the aqua green which looks more like an aqua silver(?). I expected it to be nice, but not this nice. It's like I went from a beat up Buick(with a suped up engine) to a Mercedes. This thing is premium luxury. At least in my opinion.Pros - Extremely attractive phone. Premium. Luxury. Thin and light. Great specs. Great screen. Great camera, better than most. Everything you want out of a high end device. There are also some customization's I can do with this phone that I couldn't do with the Note which is surprising.Con's - It heats up quick. The top back gets hot, but it hasn't bothered me or the phone. And I've been using it all day. I have yet to experience the over exaggerated issue with this. Hopefully I don't. The specs are a hair below other premium devices like the Note and you can tell. It is a hair slower. The biggest issue I have is with the battery. I have not been able to plug it because I've never seen a plug like this before. I'm going to have to get some kind of adapter. I've been charging it with the USB and it's been slowwwwww. It won't charge if you're using it. It wastes more than it gets. The battery drains faster than usual. Hopefully there is a fix for all of this.Overall - Despite the con's, I couldn't be happier. Best phone I've ever owned and I can say that while using it for less than a day.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: Bought the phone 2 weeks ago. The phone came in a small box, and it is a Hong Kong version, with everything in Chinese since this is a international version of the phone. I use T-Mobile in USA, and it worked just find with the LTE. The phone did came with a VERY SMALL scratch on the side. I contact the seller, and they are willing to take the phone back for a look and replace a new one, but I had to leave town couple of days later so I did not return it since it was a very small scratch, and they were willing to accept the return. The seller however was not from Sony, it is by OE USA. The phone is also very thin and I am still not fully used to it, also I took the phone to the pool, and was able to use it for a good while, but it started to heat up and after a long while, it turn off by itself. After that I was able to turn my phone back on with no problem at all. So far I like it, will give more update later.Update Oct 21 2015- The phone seem to work fine still, one problem I do seem to be having is that when I put a phone call on speaker, the other caller seem to not be able to hear me when I talk. Not sure what is the cause of the problem.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: Pros: * it looks really nice. I have received many complements for this phone from people (at least to me) * it feels very nice and it is pretty sturdy! I have dropped it many times but it still works and the screen is not shattered.Cons: * Don't buy this phone. The overheating issue is not something you can look over. It makes the phone literally unusable. Overheating causes this phone to slow down significantly to the point you want to scream. Any app that uses the CPU intensively slows down the phone. I will list the top apps that you practically can't use:1- Camera: YOU CANNOT USE THE CAMERA more than a minute or so. It becomes very unfortunate when you are recording a rare event (let's say a concert and your camera app shuts down because the phone is overheated. You cannot trust the camera for being quick and responsive either when your phone is hot. It takes a while to load and start working. 2- Maps (navigation): navigation is a CPU heavy process. That means it no camera or any other feature of your phone while that's happening. To be fair, you can make calls but the phone works so slow that it really goes on your nerves! 3- Snapchat: Snapchat is impossible to use on this phone. even if the phone is perfectly idle, Snapchat kills your phone. It makes your phone extremely hot in in tens of seconds and becomes unresponsive until. It's not to say you can't use it at all, it's just you have wait and be patient when you are using it. so if something is happening and you want to send a quick snap of that moment, you should forget about that! Even worse, if you connect your phone to a charger and open Snapchat your phone gets hot in no time and although the charger is still connected you battery percentage keeps slowly going down. 4- Skype: it's like Snapchat but a little better. You can't really use skype and multi-task. Skype alone is very heavy on the phone.

Product.Name: Sony Xperia Z3+ (Z3 Plus) E6553 5.2-Inch 32GB Factory Unlocked Smartphone (Black) - International Stock no warranty
Reviews: So I bought this sweet looking new phone with a few accessories, a Devilcase aluminum case, and a magnetic charging dock.Surprise! Sony has removed the magnetic charging for it, moved the USB charging port to the bottom of the phone, and switched sides on the slot that contains the SD card and the nano sim.So, not only was my cool magnetic charging dock not going to work at all, the cool new aluminum case would have to have the screw removed and removed every time I wanted to charge it... Obviously, a no go either.The functionality of the phone itself is near flawless, I especially enjoy the Remote Play feature that allows you to use it as a second monitor or rather the main screen for playing the ps4 on. Connecting of the controller to the phone is a pretty seamless process, and all you have to do to connect it back to the ps4 is plug it back into the ps4.Overall, the phone works great, I was just a little bummed about the whole magnetic charging things. I don't know how this escaped to my attention, eith all the research I put into it.I will update as we go with this

Reviews: So I had done a lot of research before the purchase of this phone and it is absolutely fantastic. Please not that after you sign in and get set up it will require updated that will take at least 30-45min as the phone updated to Marshmallow from Lollipop.> Excellent build> Great Battery life> Performance is amazing> Screen is beautiful and clean, the built in email app is fantastic,> if you have an Outlook, Hotmail or Live email and use MS for everything, this app is better than the Outlook app and it syncs to the phone Calendar and contacts> I have a 128G card in the phone and its easy to move apps to the card> overall could not be happierOnly issue I have is HFP for the Google maps and Texting through my cars Audio system. Not sure if its the BT profile or the OS that is the issue, research has shown at this moment its the OS and how Google handles HFP.Update: 4-6-2016 down graded to 1 star, Woke up this morning to the phone beeping, would not turn on so I shut it down holding the power button. Restarted and thought all was good. As I started to work on the phone it got really hot and I received a message that the UI was not longer workingI restarted several times but no luck. I have returned the phone, Amazon is great on stuff like this. I have chosen to go with the Moto X Pure Edition as it has the Snapdragon 808 vs the 810 that seems to have issues. I truly loved the size and feel of the Sony and was hoping the issues were do to bad users, unfortunately the units are probably just bad. (I did update to the latest firmware and Marshmallow software using the Sony desktop application as recommended)

Reviews: This phone just blows your other phones out of the water. It quite literally is the best phone out there. If you buy itbrand new, international, Amazon is kind enough to include an adapter for the phone for wherever they are shipping the device to. The phone, brand new takesa few updates that'll take take around 3 hours to finish, but once you're done, it's Marshmallow(latest Android update) heaven baby. The phone, despite being a last generation Xperia Device can take anything you throw at it. Any app, any game, it'll heat up to a point, but not enough to shut it down or damage the device. Heat is only natural for these devices as there are no other ways to disperse the heat besides the built in heat sinks. And the heat is not a bad thing, that just means your phone is doing work.I give this phone a 5/5 for now let's wait for the upcoming weeks.
